0.title: Viral pic of Shah Rukh Khan with long hair and a beard is photoshopped
0.article_body: A photoshopped picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan showing him with long hair and a salt-and-pepper beard has gone viral online. The picture was taken by Dabboo Ratnani in 2017 and the celebrity photographer shared the original after the altered picture was widely shared. Many of Shah Rukh's fans claimed that this was the actor's 'new look'.

1.title: Which Indians have defeated world number one chess player Magnus Carlsen?
1.article_body: India's 16-year-old chess player Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa became the third Indian Grandmaster to defeat world number one Magnus Carlsen after defeating him in 39 moves at the Airthings Masters, a 16-player online rapid tournament. The other two Indians to defeat Carlsen in official tournament matches are Viswanathan Anand and Pentala Harikrishna. Carlsen has been world number one since July 2021.

2.title: Bhumi Pednekar wraps up shooting for 'Bhakshak' in 39 days
2.article_body: Bhumi Pednekar took to Twitter on Monday to share that she has completed filming for her upcoming film 'Bhakshak'. She wrote, "It has been an emotional roller-coaster, and 39 days later, we wrap #Bhakshak." She added that the film will always remain close to her heart. 'Bhakshak' is directed by Pulkit and produced by Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment.

3.title: SP has given full protection to terrorists: BJP Spokesperson
3.article_body: BJP Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Monday said, "The Samajwadi Party (SP) has given protection to terrorists on its cycles." He said, "In 2006, SP said the Students' Islamic Movement of India is not a terror outfit. Did [SP] not work to support terrorism?" Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also said SP is "playing with the security of the country".

4.title: Lamborghini Huracan blown up by artist for NFT project; video released
4.article_body: Pseudonymous conceptual artist SHL0MS has announced that they have blown up a Lamborghini Huracan sports car for an NFT art project. The car was blown up at an undisclosed desert location. As many as 999 fragments of the car were meticulously categorised, documented, and filmed in stunning rotating videos and each individual video piece will be sold as an NFT.

5.title: Premature to talk about any plans for summits: Russia on Biden-Putin meet
5.article_body: Russia has said it's "premature" to talk about any plans for any kind of summits after France President Emmanuel Macron's office said that both Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Joe Biden were open to the idea amid Ukraine crisis. "There is an understanding that dialogue should be continued at the level of foreign ministers," the Kremlin spokesperson added.

6.title: Man dies after inhaling gas from geyser inside bathroom at Gurugram hotel
6.article_body: A man was found dead inside the bathroom of a hotel room in Gurugram after allegedly inhaling gas from a geyser, police said on Monday. The hotel's owner and manager have been booked. The complainant, who was staying at the same hotel, said the bathroom door was broken after the victim didn't come out even after 25 minutes.

7.title: 'Badhaai Do' actress Chum Darang felicitated by Arunachal Pradesh CM
7.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu felicitated actress Chum Darang who was recently seen in Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar-starrer comedy film 'Badhaai Do'. She shared a few pictures on her Instagram handle, writing, "Being lauded for something that you've put your heart and soul into feels amazing." 'Badhaai Do' marked Chum Darang's debut in the Hindi film industry.

8.title: 10 more weather stations to be set up in Pune before monsoon
8.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) will install at least ten more Automatic Weather Stations (AWS) in the Pune district, in addition to those already installed at 25 locations, for round-the-clock monitoring. The AWS records key parameters like temperature, rainfall, humidity, etc. KS Hosalikar, Climate Research and Services head of IMD, Pune, said installation work will end before monsoon.

9.title: 76 arrested for violence amid Odisha rural polls; re-polling declared at 45 booths
9.article_body: Several incidents of violence and attempts of booth capturing were reported during the ongoing panchayat elections in Odisha. The State Election Commission (SEC) has announced re-polling at 45 booths across Jajpur, Kendrapara, Puri and Dhenkanal districts, where the voting process was disrupted due to violence. Police have arrested 76 people from these districts in connection with violence.

10.title: Driver runs away with ATM refill van carrying ₹35 lakh cash in Hyd
10.article_body: A driver of a cash transit vehicle ran away with ₹35 lakh cash meant for refilling an ATM machine in Hyderabad. Police are now searching for the driver of the cash logistics management company following the incident at Dundigal on Saturday. The vehicle was reportedly traced in the nearby forest area but the accused driver fled with the cash bag.

11.title: 16-year-old girl missing from West Bengal found in Gurugram
11.article_body: A 16-year-old girl who was reported to be missing by her parents in West Bengal was recused by Gurugram Police from Tigra village in Sector 57. The girl had left her home to meet a 23-year-old boy from Gurugram, according to the police. The girl and the boy had known each other for a long time, the police said.

12.title: 48 kg cannabis seized in UP's Shamli district, 2 arrested
12.article_body: The police in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district seized 48 kg of cannabis and arrested two suspected smugglers, officials said on Monday. The suspects were identified as Satbir and Shakil. SSP Sukirti Madhav said the drugs were seized after the police intercepted a car during regular checking. The car has also been impounded.

13.title: You last held my hand when I was leaving for 'Baarish' shoot: Hina on late father
13.article_body: Actress Hina Khan took to Instagram to post pictures with her late father and share that it has been ten months since he passed away. She wrote, "Last it was when you held my hand, hugged me, dropped me to elevator...while I was leaving for shoot for Baarish...Ten months today. Miss you in everything..I feel you in everything and everyone."

14.title: Tom Cruise had a terrible temper; he threw an album hard at me: Ex-manager
14.article_body: Tom Cruise's ex-manager Eileen Berlin spoke about the actor's temper issues in the early stages of his career. She said, "Tommy had a terrible temper. He harboured...lot of anger at his natural father. He would get angry in a snap of your fingers." She added that once he threw an album at her and it hit her on the cheek.

15.title: Fog hits flight services at Kolkata airport, many passengers stuck
15.article_body: Dense fog disrupted flight operations at the Kolkata airport on Monday morning, following which many passengers were stranded. Officials said no flight could take off or land at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport in the city as a thick blanket of fog engulfed the area. The flights that were supposed to land were diverted to nearby airports.

16.title: Police look for 14 women who escaped from rescue home in Hyderabad
16.article_body: Police are searching for 14 women who escaped from a Hyderabad rescue home after reportedly breaking open metal grills and mesh of the window. The runaway inmates housed at Ujwala Rescue Home in Hydershakote, Narsingi, escaped in the early hours on Friday. KGNMT's P Padmavathi said they might have fled as they were scared of being stuck there for long.

17.title: Don't play with people's lives in eastern Ukraine: Germany to Russia
17.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has accused Russia of playing an "irresponsible" game with the civilian population of eastern Ukraine's Donbas amid ongoing tensions in the region. Baerbock's comments came after sporadic shelling was reported in Donbas' Donetsk on Saturday, which is controlled by pro-Russian separatists. Two soldiers were killed in the shelling, Ukrainian Army had said.

18.title: 35-year-old milkman found dead in Delhi's Rohini
18.article_body: A 35-year-old milkman was found dead on the Heliport road in Delhi's Rohini area on Monday, the police said. After information regarding the presence of a body was received, the Begumpur police station SHO reached the spot. The deceased has been identified as Pradeep, a resident of Rithala. His motorcycle was also found at the spot.

19.title: Oversized white table in Putin's pics costs around ₹84 lakh, says its designer
19.article_body: The 12-ft-long white table, which was seen in pictures of Russian President Vladimir Putin's various meetings, was provided to the Kremlin in 1995. Renato Pologna, whose company Oak designed the table, said that even bigger tables were designed for Kremlin as part of the contract. He added that a similar table would cost around €100,000 (around ₹84 lakh) today.

20.title: Evangeline requests Canadian PM to meet vaccine mandate protesters
20.article_body: Actress Evangeline Lilly has requested Canadian PM Justin Trudeau to meet the groups protesting over vaccine mandates and pandemic restrictions in the country. "They have asked to meet with you, Prime Minister...intelligent, loving, concerned citizens. Why won't you sit with them?" Evangeline says in a video. Protesters have demanded that the authorities remove COVID-19 restrictions in Canada.

21.title: 12 lakh govt positions vacant but jobs not given: Sonia Gandhi
21.article_body: Campaigning for UP polls, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Monday accused the government of failing to provide jobs to youth despite lakhs of vacant positions. "Youth study and prepare for jobs but the BJP government made you sit at home. 12 lakh government jobs are vacant but you've not been given jobs," said Gandhi in a virtual address.

22.title: Under BJP's rule, industrialists loot banks and run away: SP chief
22.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav said the BJP government "isn't a government for the poor, but for the rich". Speaking at a public rally in Raebareli, Yadav said, "We won't get a loan easily...but big industrialists ran away after looting banks." He added, "Be alert, BJP can do anything as they're going to lose UP polls."

23.title: Haryana govt cancels board exams for classes 5 and 8 for this session
23.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday announced that it will not conduct board examination for classes 5 and 8 for this session. Chief Minister Manohar Lal said board exams for the two classes will be held from the next session. "The examinations of both CBSE and Board of School Education Haryana (BSEH) have been postponed for the time being," he added.

24.title: CPI(M) worker hacked to death in Kerala's Kannur; party blames RSS, BJP
24.article_body: A 54-year-old CPI(M) worker was allegedly hacked to death by some assailants in front of his house near Thalassery in Kerala's Kannur on Monday early morning, police said. The incident took place when the victim was home after fishing, police added. CPI(M) has called it a "political murder" and blamed a group of RSS and BJP workers for the killing.

25.title: Kartik, Ranbir, Shraddha seen in all-white at Luv Ranjan's wedding
25.article_body: Pictures of actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor among others have surfaced dressed in all-white for filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding in Agra. Actress Rakul Preet Singh and boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani were clicked holding hands. Additionally, actors Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma were seen arriving dressed casually. Luv got married to his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid on Sunday.

26.title: They said you look 'sick': Bobby on sons' reaction to his 'Love Hostel' look
26.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, speaking about his look in the upcoming film 'Love Hostel', said, "Many people were taken aback as they never imagined that I looked so fearful and evil." He added that the best reaction came from his sons, Aryaman Deol and Dharam Deol. "[They] told me you look 'sick', which is the new terminology for cool," said Bobby.

27.title: Google settles lawsuit by ex-manager alleging pregnancy discrimination in US
27.article_body: Google has reached a settlement with a former US employee who had alleged that she faced discrimination by the company after she became pregnant with her second child. Chelsey Glasson, a former manager at Google, said her experience at the company left her with insomnia, panic attacks and heart palpitations. She confirmed the settlement to Bloomberg but didn't provide details.

28.title: Caste-based census in Bihar will benefit everyone: CM Nitish Kumar
28.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said on Monday that the state government is committed to doing a caste-based census in the state. "We want to hold an all-party meeting to take everyone's ideas, their experience as to how to do it. It will benefit everyone," he said. The government will ensure that the caste-based census is implemented properly, he added.

29.title: BJP-RSS come to Manipur with sense of superiority: Rahul Gandhi
29.article_body: Ahead of upcoming Assembly polls in Manipur, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said BJP and RSS leaders come to the state with a sense of superiority. "When BJP and RSS come to Manipur, they do not come with respect or understanding. They come with a sense of superiority...I come here with humility," Gandhi stated in Imphal.

30.title: GHMC completes partial rejuvenation of Hyderbad's Langar Houz lake
30.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) completed the first phase of rejuvenation of the Langar Houz lake on Friday. The civic body has cleared the lake of hyacinth and other trash, GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal tweeted. Beautification work, including a walking track around the lake and an increase in green cover, will be completed in the second phase, Gadwal added.

31.title: B'luru bans protests near institutions till March 8 amid hijab issue
31.article_body: Amid the hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police has extended the ban on protests within a 200-metre radius of any school, college and other educational institutions till March 8. The ban was first imposed on February 9. "Since the issue is still alive and the possibility of holding protests, for and against the same...cannot be ruled out," an order said.

32.title: Elephant rescued from ditch by filling it with water in WB, IFS officer shares clip
32.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared a video of the rescue of an elephant who had fallen in a ditch in West Bengal. Kaswan said the Forest Department applied Archimedes' principle (filled the ditch with water to raise the animal upwards) in the rescue. The rescue of the elephant was completed at 4 am, Kaswan said.

33.title: Responsibility is always put on daughters; have seen it happen at home: Navya
33.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda addressed the prevalence of patriarchy in a joint family setup. She said, "I've seen this happen at my home where if guests are over, my mother would always tell me to fetch something or the other." Navya added in big families, the responsibility of how to run the house is always put on daughters.

34.title: Actor Pawan Kalyan falls on car's roof after fan jumps to hug him, video surfaces
34.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Pawan Kalyan falling down on the car's roof after a fan jumped to hug him. Pawan Kalyan was greeting his fans in Narasapuram when he climbed to the car's roof from the sunroof to give fans a glimpse of him. The fan then suddenly appeared from behind after which the actor tripped.

35.title: Eventually, I think I would get into politics: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover
35.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, when asked about his future plans, said, "A few things are in the works. Eventually, I think I would get into politics at some point in time." He said, "When you build a business, you generate a certain employment and impact a certain number of people." He added, "The bigger impact...is by getting into nation-building."

36.title: You have to enjoy moment when you've been so near death: Sonali on cancer
36.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, while talking about her battle with cancer, said she sometimes gets insecure about her looks but then tells herself that it's not the only thing about her. "It's about what I am...and what I bring to the table," Sonali said, adding, "I have understood you have to be in moment...enjoy it...especially when you've been so near death."

37.title: SDMC opens 'Nigam Haat' to promote waste recycling in Sarita Vihar
37.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has inaugurated a 'Nigam Haat' in Sarita Vihar with an aim to promote the reduction and recycling of waste at the source. Over 30 eco-friendly products, made from unused and abandoned items, will be available at the shop, a senior municipal official said. This is the second such shop set up by the SDMC.

38.title: No question of water cuts this summer in Pune, says civic body
38.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has said that water cuts in the city are unlikely this summer season. "We will be distributing water judiciously and so with the present water stock there is no question of water cuts," said the head of water resources at PMC's water department. Another official said the water levels are good for Pune city.

39.title: Nisha Rawal confirmed as first contestant of Kangana's 'Lock Upp'
39.article_body: Television actress Nisha Rawal has been announced as the first contestant of reality television show 'Lock Upp: Badass Jail, Atyaachaari Khel'. In the promo video, Nisha is seen in handcuffs wearing an orange jumpsuit. She is charged with 'controversial fights'. "I'm very excited to make this...challenging journey...This show will set a new benchmark in the Indian OTT industry," Nisha said.

40.title: I'm an actor who happens to be deaf: Troy Kotsur on Oscar nomination
40.article_body: Actor Troy Kotsur, who is the first deaf actor to receive an Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Role, has said that he is an actor who happens to be deaf. Troy portrays a deaf fisherman in 'CODA' who relies on his hearing daughter to translate for him. "I'm sure...deaf community...[is] very excited...because awareness has been increased of them," Troy said.

41.title: Wanted to replicate what I did in 1st T20I: Suryakumar on his 65 in 3rd T20I
41.article_body: Talking about his 31-ball 65 in India's 17-run win against West Indies in third T20I, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he wanted to replicate what he did in the first T20I. Suryakumar had scored 18-ball 34* in first match at Eden Gardens. He was adjudged 'Player of the Series'. India completed a 3-0 whitewash against West Indies in T20I series.

42.title: BA.2 is sub-lineage of Omicron, won’t infect people who had BA.1: IMA official
42.article_body: Co-Chairman National IMA COVID-19 Task Force, Dr Rajeev Jayadevan, said that BA.2 is a sub-lineage of Omicron and is not capable of infecting people who had BA.1. "It's not a new virus or strain. It's a sub-lineage and will be more transmissible than BA.1 but will not cause another surge," Jayadevan added.

43.title: Fire breaks out at Hotel Sea Princess in Mumbai, no one injured
43.article_body: A fire was reported on the first floor of the five-star Hotel Sea Princess in Mumbai's Juhu on Monday. No injury was reported in the incident. The fire broke out around 10.30 am and fire brigade officials reached the spot and extinguished the fire around 11 am, an official of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said.

44.title: Beijing adds fertility services to insurance to encourage more births
44.article_body: Beijing will include 16 fertility services in a government-backed medical insurance coverage scheme to encourage more births amid record-low birth rate in China, local media has reported. Services using assisted reproductive technologies will reportedly be covered by the insurance from March 26 onwards. China's birthrate dropped from 8.52 (births per 1,000 people) in 2020 to 7.52 in 2021.

45.title: Glass tumbler removed from man’s colon in Bihar, he says 'swallowed with tea'
45.article_body: Doctors in Bihar removed a glass tumbler from the colon of a 55-year-old man who had been suffering from acute constipation and abdominal pain. Speaking about the case, Dr Makhdulul Haq, who headed the team of surgeons said, "The patient said he swallowed the tumbler while having tea. That is, however, not a convincing explanation."

46.title: Ranveer dedicates Best Actor award to 'Kapil's devils', 83 cast
46.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who was named Best Actor at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards on Sunday for his performance in '83', has dedicated the award to the "legacy of Kapil (Dev's) devils". "I share this award with...cast and crew of 83," he added. The film, directed by Kabir Khan, is based on India's win in the 1983 Cricket World Cup.

47.title: COVID-19 booster rollout too slow, say majority of Japanese: Survey
47.article_body: A survey has found that a majority of Japanese think that the rollout of the COVID-19 booster shots have been too slow in the country. While 73% of the survey respondents said the rollout was slow, 54.1% of them still approved the overall handling of the pandemic. About 14.4% of the population has reportedly received booster shots so far.

48.title: 134 flights, 683 trains cancelled in Japan due to bad weather
48.article_body: As many as 134 flights and 683 trains were reportedly cancelled in Japan's Hokkaido island due to bad weather on Monday. Strong winds with speed up to 138 feet per second combined with heavy snowfall were witnessed in the region including the island's capital Sapporo. In many areas, the snow cover was reported to be as deep as 38 inches.

49.title: What were the top individual scores in Ranji Trophy's first round?
49.article_body: Bihar's 22-year-old batter Sakibul Gani registered the highest individual score in Ranji Trophy's first round by scoring 341 in the first innings against Mizoram. The second highest individual score in the round was registered by Mumbai's Sarfaraz Khan, who scored 275 runs against Saurashtra. Bihar's Babul Kumar scored an unbeaten 229, while Maharashtra opener Pavan Shah scored 219.

50.title: Auto driver takes 24-year-old nurse to isolated area in Mumbai, flashes himself to her
50.article_body: Mumbai police have arrested an auto-rickshaw driver for allegedly molesting a 24-year-old nurse. The auto-rickshaw driver reportedly took the nurse to an isolated place where he stopped the vehicle and flashed himself to her. When she started screaming and running, he molested her. The incident occurred on February 17, when the nurse was returning from night duty.

51.title: Credit Suisse denies alleged wrongdoing after client data gets leaked
51.article_body: Credit Suisse said it "strongly rejects" allegations of wrongdoing after media outlets published findings of investigations into a leak of data on the bank's accounts. The bank allegedly has human rights abusers and businessmen who had been placed under sanctions as its clients. The bank said about 90% of the reviewed accounts are either closed or in process of closure.

52.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav sentenced to 5 yrs in jail, fined ₹60 lakh in 5th fodder scam case
52.article_body: A special CBI court in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Monday sentenced former Bihar CM and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav to five years imprisonment in the fifth fodder scam case. The court has also slapped a fine of ₹60 lakh on him in connection with the case. The court had convicted Lalu in the case on February 15.

53.title: Model Chrissy reveals undergoing IVF cycle, says 'Stop asking people if they're pregnant'
53.article_body: Model Chrissy Teigen announced she is undergoing another IVF cycle, almost a year after losing her son Jack during pregnancy loss. She wrote, "I humbly beg you to stop asking if I'm pregnant...[W]hile I know it’s said with...good intentions...it just kind of sucks to hear because I'm the opposite of pregnant...Also like please stop asking people.. if they’re pregnant."

54.title: All batters can take a leaf out of his book: Kieron Pollard on Suryakumar Yadav
54.article_body: Praising Suryakumar Yadav, who slammed 65 runs off 31 deliveries in the third T20I, West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said, "He is a world-class player. He is doing great things for himself and India as a 360-degree player." Pollard added, "All batters can take a leaf out of his book." Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

55.title: He was in touch with 70-75 other women: Police on Odisha man who married 27 women
55.article_body: Police said that Bibhu Prakash Swain, the man arrested from Odisha for marrying at least 27 women in 10 states, "was in touch with 70-75 other women whom he could've married". "He preyed on unsuspecting women looking for security and love," police said. He also defrauded 13 banks in Kerala of ₹1 crore through 128 forged credit cards in 2006.

56.title: Dr Lal PathLabs, Metropolis and other labs' shares fall as COVID-19 eases
56.article_body: The shares of listed Indian clinical labs including Dr Lal PathLabs and Metropolis Healthcare have fallen at least 30% this year as COVID-19 testing reduced due to the easing of the outbreak. The stock of Thyrocare Technologies has already lost a fifth of its value in 2022. Shares of these companies had at least doubled in the previous two years.

57.title: Flipkart to sell Cleartrip's Middle East business to Wego
57.article_body: Flipkart has signed a definitive agreement with Wego, a Singapore-headquartered online travel marketplace, to sell Cleartrip's Middle East business. The transaction also includes the sale of Flyin.com and a technology cooperation agreement between Wego and Flipkart. The deal has been approved by the directors of both companies and is expected to close in the second half of 2022.

58.title: Anil Kapoor, son Harsh Varrdhan team up for thriller film 'Thar'
58.article_body: Anil Kapoor and his actor son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor are teaming up for a revenge thriller film, titled 'Thar'. The forthcoming project, produced by Anil Kapoor Film Company (AKFC), marks the directorial debut of Raj Singh Chaudhary who has also written the film. 'Thar' also stars Fatima Sana Shaikh and Satish Kaushik.

59.title: On March 10, Akhilesh will say 'EVM bewafa hai': Anurag Thakur on polls
59.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav will not be able to "cross even 100 after seven phases". "On 10th March (counting of votes), he'll say 'EVM bewafa hai'. He'll lose from Karhal too. SP's 'gunda raj', 'mafia raj' and collusion with terrorists will not be accepted by people," Thakur said.

60.title: Got famous after Tezaab's release; a kid asked me 'Are you Ek Do Teen': Madhuri
60.article_body: Madhuri Dixit recalled she became famous after the release of her film 'Tezaab' in which she played 'Mohini' and was known for her song 'Ek Do Teen'. She said, "There were...kids running around and then one of them spotted me. He...asked, excitedly, 'Are you Ek Do Teen? Can I have an autograph?' So I gave him an autograph," she said.

61.title: 9-yr-old girl dies after her hair gets stuck in swimming pool drain in Brazil
61.article_body: A nine-year-old girl died in Brazil after her hair got sucked in the drain of a swimming pool during her grandmother’s birthday party. Mariana dos Anjos Faria was swimming in the resort pool when the incident took place and wasn't breathing when she was pulled out. While her father tried to resuscitate her, she was declared dead at the hospital.

62.title: BJP, Cong wanted such incident: Ex-K'taka CM on activist's murder
62.article_body: Former Chief Minister of Karnataka and Janta Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy said that he had predicted a development like the murder of the Bajrang Dal activist when the hijab row had begun in the state. "We saw the death of boy...This is the achievement of Congress and BJP...They destabilised peace of state...They wanted this kind of incident," he said.

63.title: Missing 14-yr-old's decomposing body found in gunny bag in Delhi; 1 held for rape
63.article_body: A week after a 14-year-old girl went missing, Delhi Police has found her decomposing body in a gunny bag in Delhi's Narela area. According to police, the deceased was allegedly gang-raped by two men, who had managed to escape after committing the crime on February 12. One of the accused has been arrested from Sannoth village in Narela, police added.

64.title: 'The Suicide Squad' director James Gunn gets engaged to actress Jennifer Holland
64.article_body: 'The Suicide Squad' director James Gunn took to Instagram to announce his engagement to longtime girlfriend and actress Jennifer Holland. The duo have been in a relationship since 2015. Holland has starred in several of Gunn's projects. She played Emilia Harcourt in 'The Suicide Squad' and also reprised that role in 'Peacemaker'.

65.title: Ranveer Singh shares pic of him fist bumping LeBron James, says 'I am shook'
65.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who played the NBA All-Star Game recently, took to Instagram to share a picture of him fist bumping four-time NBA champion LeBron James. "The King and I...What a precious moment...I am shook!" Ranveer captioned the picture. Commenting on it, actor Tiger Shroff wrote, "Legendary moment" while Sophie Choudry wrote, "Epic."

66.title: That so called journalist needs to be exposed: Parthiv on journalist threatening Saha
66.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of threatening texts sent to him by a journalist, ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel tweeted, "A 'journalist' threatening a player and that too an India player for an interview must be new and certainly a low point." He added, "That so called journalist needs to be exposed so...entire community doesn’t get a bad name."

67.title: 7 arrested in Mumbai with mephedrone worth ₹25 lakh, 200 cough syrup bottles
67.article_body: Seven persons were arrested with mephedrone (MD) worth ₹25 lakh and 200 bottles of cough syrup in two operations conducted in Mumbai, police said. While a man was arrested with 250 grams of MD in Ghatkopar, police arrested six persons from Govandi with cough syrup bottles. The accused were supplying cough syrup for illegal sale as an intoxicant, police added.

68.title: Digital divide is rapidly shrinking in India: PM Narendra Modi
68.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that the digital divide is rapidly shrinking in India. "Digital connectivity is what kept our education system alive in this time of a global pandemic…Innovation is ensuring our inclusion," PM Modi added. He addressed a webinar virtually on 'Post budget seminar: Fostering strong industry-skill linkage.'

69.title: Who is Anmol Ambani's wife Khrisha Shah?
69.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani has got married to Khrisha Shah. According to reports, Shah was born and brought up in Mumbai and is a social worker and entrepreneur. She founded Dysco, a social network company. She was earlier an employee of Accenture in the UK and later returned to India to become an entrepreneur.

70.title: Feels like yesterday: Mohnish Bahl on mother Nutan's 31st death anniversary
70.article_body: Actor Mohnish Bahl took to Instagram to share late mother Nutan's picture on her 31st death anniversary. "Feels like yesterday," he captioned the picture. Several fans also took to the comment section to pay tributes to the late actress. "Remembering gorgeous leading lady of yesteryear, one of the finest actresses of Indian cinema, #Nutan ji," one wrote.

71.title: K'taka HM should resign: Siddaramaiah on Bajrang Dal activist's killing
71.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah condemned the alleged murder of Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha in Karnataka’s Shivamogga. "It took place in the district from where the Home Minister and CM come. The culprit should be hanged. I demand the state Home Minister’s resignation," Siddaramaiah added. Following the incident, Shivamogga Deputy Commissioner said that Section 144 has been imposed in the area.

72.title: My father's beaming with joy on anything to do with sport, me: Deepika on '83'
72.article_body: Talking about her and husband Ranveer Singh's film '83' and how her father Prakash Padukone reacted to it, Deepika Padukone said, "Anything to do with sport...anything to do with me...my father is always beaming with pride...and joy." She also said while her family is proud of her, they are also critical. She said her mother and sister are "brutally honest".

73.title: I give my son & daughter-in-law space; don't interfere in their matters: Mithun
73.article_body: Speaking about his son Mimoh Chakraborty and his daughter-in-law Madalsa Sharma, veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty said that he doesn't interfere in their matters. He added, "Madalsa has become a big star now with her show 'Anupama'." "It's good to have her home. But my wife and I give them their space," Mithun said.

74.title: Stand united else 2023 Assembly polls will be last in MP: Digvijaya to Cong workers
74.article_body: In a viral video, Congress leader Digvijaya Singh asked party workers to stand united for the 2023 Assembly polls in MP. "You're not ready to sit together...This will not do. I am telling you the election of 2023 will be the last one. If you won't contest elections honestly then be ready to sit at home," Singh added.

75.title: Australia fully reopens borders for vaccinated international travellers
75.article_body: After nearly two years of stringent COVID-19 curbs, Australia fully reopened its borders for vaccinated international travellers on Monday. "It is a very exciting day, one that I have been looking forward to for a long time, from the day that I first shut that border right at the start of the pandemic," said Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

76.title: Justin Bieber tests +ve for COVID-19, postpones Justice World Tour concert
76.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber has tested positive for COVID-19. A representative for the singer told TMZ that he contracted the virus on Saturday but "thankfully is feeling OK". Bieber was supposed to perform in Las Vegas on Sunday as part of his Justice World Tour, but the show has now been rescheduled to June 28.

77.title: Kajal Aggarwal shares pictures from her baby shower
77.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, who's expecting her first child with husband Gautam Kitchlu, shared some pictures from her baby shower on her Instagram Stories on Sunday. She also shared a picture with Gautam with a caption that read, "Godbharai." The couple announced the pregnancy in a cryptic post earlier this year. Kajal and Gautam tied the knot in October 2020.

78.title: Man blackmails, rapes wife’s minor sister in Noida; arrested
78.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his wife's 16-year-old sister in Noida. He allegedly blackmailed the victim using a clip of the sexual assault. According to police, the accused sexually assaulted the minor girl on several occasions since last April and also forced her to undergo an abortion when she became pregnant.

79.title: Consume cooked chicken, eggs without hesitation: Official on bird flu
79.article_body: President of Poultry Farmers & Breeders Association (Maharashtra), C Vasanthkumar, while speaking about bird flu, said consumers can consume cooked chicken and eggs without hesitation. "Infection is limited to particular area...Manner in which we prepare chicken is different from that in other countries...we cook it above 70 degrees Celsius...There is no chance of survival of pathogen," he said.

80.title: 24-yr-old Delhi woman murders mother after she threatens to disown her, held
80.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly murdering her mother in Delhi with her friend's help after her mother threatened to disown her. The accused had left her husband and was living with another man, police said, adding that her mother was not happy with this. The victim was frustrated as her mother had stopped helping her financially, police said.

81.title: World still doesn't make sense, I miss her greatly: Andrew on mother's death
81.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, while talking about losing his mother Lynn Garfield to cancer, said, "It is very, very difficult." "For period of time I didn't want to, and I wasn't able to, do anything. I was...wasted...world didn't make sense...it still doesn't, because I miss her greatly...I hope it never makes sense because I always want to miss her," he said.

82.title: YouTube star Jamal Edwards, whose channel launched Ed Sheeran's career, dies at 31
82.article_body: British music entrepreneur and YouTube star Jamal Edwards, whose channel launched careers of several musicians like Ed Sheeran, passed away at the age of 31. Edwards was also a director, author, DJ and designer, and he was awarded an MBE in 2014 for his work in music. The cause of his death is not known yet.

83.title: 16-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats world number one Carlsen
83.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the eighth round of the Airthings Masters, an online rapid chess tournament. Praggnanandhaa won with black pieces in 39 moves to halt Carlsen's run of three straight wins. The Indian Grandmaster is currently on the joint 12th spot in the tournment after eight rounds with eight points.

84.title: Trump's Truth Social app launches on Apple App Store
84.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's new social media venture, Truth Social, has been launched on Apple's App Store. The app was available to download shortly before midnight ET and was automatically downloaded to Apple devices belonging to users who had pre-ordered the app, Reuters reported. Notably, Trump was banned from Twitter, Facebook and YouTube following the 2021 US Capitol attack.

85.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed in K'taka's Shivamogga; Sec 144 imposed, schools shut
85.article_body: A 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha was allegedly murdered in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Sunday night. Following the incident, Shivamogga Deputy Commissioner said that Section 144 has been imposed in the area. "As a precautionary measure, schools and colleges in city limits have been closed for two days," Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said on Monday.

86.title: Maha BJP MLA & 35 others booked for taking out bike rally, violating COVID norms
86.article_body: BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Chikhali, Shweta Mahale Patil and her 35 women supporters were booked by the local police for taking out a bike rally on Saturday to celebrate Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's birth anniversary. They were booked for violating COVID-19 protocols. The permission was denied for the rally citing COVID-19 restrictions in the state, according to the local police.

87.title: Union Budget will help in implementing National Education Policy: PM
87.article_body: Union Budget will help in implementing the National Education Policy, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "National Digital University is an unprecedented step. The problem of shortage of seats can be resolved. There will be unlimited seats. I urge all the stakeholders to ensure digital uni starts as soon as possible," PM Modi added.

88.title: It was really emotional: Courteney Cox on 'Friends' reunion
88.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox recalled her experience of reuniting with her 'Friends' cast in the reunion special. She said, "We went through so many things together, everything from parents dying to marriages, divorces. It was such a period where so many changes took place." "The reunion was really emotional. I love these people. There's such history," Courteney said.

89.title: Unless on-screen, it's assumed you have kid; aren't interested for work: Bhumika
89.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla said that she needs to be "seen for producers and directors to understand" that she is still working. "Unless you're seen on-screen, people assume that you're married, you have a child, so you're not interested. So, social media and PR comes handy at that time," she said, adding, "I have three films due for release right now."

90.title: 10 embark on swimming expedition in Guj to raise marine life awareness
90.article_body: Ten swimmers have embarked on expedition from Gujarat's Dwarka to Somnath temple in Gir Somnath. Their aim is to raise awareness about marine life of Gujarat. Bankim Joshi, who has been coaching swimmers, said, "Objective is to draw children to nature...encourage them to look around, beyond mobile phones...highlight marine life and risk it faces from pollution and irresponsible fishing practices."

91.title: Pic of Rohit Sharma taking immediate review in 3rd T20I against West Indies goes viral
91.article_body: A picture of India captain Rohit Sharma taking a caught-behind review immediately in the third T20I against West Indies after the on-field umpire declared it not out has gone viral. Rohit can be seen bending down and taking the review animatedly. Reacting to the picture, a fan tweeted, "God level review." Another fan wrote, "Reminded me of Billy Bowden."

92.title: Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani marries Khrisha Shah in Mumbai, pic surfaces
92.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani got married to Khrisha Shah in Mumbai.  GVK Vice Chairman GV Sanjay Reddy's wife Pinky Reddy took to Instagram to share photos from the event. Several personalities including actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and NCP MP Supriya Sule attended the wedding.

93.title: Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' wins Film Of The Year award at DPIFF 2022
93.article_body: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa: The Rise' bagged the Film Of The Year award at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards (DPIFF) 2022. Directed by Sukumar, the action film also featured Fahadh Faasil and Rao Ramesh. Meanwhile, Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer film 'Shershaah' won the Best Film award. 'Shershaah' was directed by Vishnu Varadhan.

94.title: 2 ITBP personnel on patrol duty injured in IED blast in poll-bound Manipur
94.article_body: Two personnel of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on election duty in Manipur were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in the Wangoo area of Kakching district. Police said the incident took place when an ITBP party along with Manipur Police personnel were conducting an area domination patrol. The injured personnel were admitted to a hospital in Kakching.

95.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed by Musalmaan goondas: Karnataka minister
95.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa said that he is very disturbed by the "murder of a Bajrang Dal activist". "He was killed by 'Musalmaan goondas' (Muslim goons). I'm going to Shivamogga now to analyse the situation. We'll not allow 'goondaism'," he added. The 26-year-old activist Harsha was allegedly murdered at around 9 pm on Sunday in Karnataka's Shivamogga.

96.title: India become world number one T20I team after 6 years
96.article_body: Following their 3-0 series victory against West Indies, India have become the world number one T20I team after six years. As per the latest update, India are on top of the rankings with 10,484 points and 269 rating points. England are second with 10,474 points and 269 rating points. India have won nine T20I matches in a row.

97.title: NPS India 2022 aims to eclipse NPS 2021 by offering more medals & prizes
97.article_body: National Poker Series India 2021 awarded 192 medals and saw 83,000+ entries, taking guaranteed ₹15-crore prize-pool to ₹19.4 crore. Mohd Azhar Tak (Rajasthan) topped NPS podium with 3 gold medals. Maharashtra (44), Delhi (37), Haryana (18) won most medals. NPS India 2022 revealed that it features 252 medals and 3 packages to Las Vegas with a guaranteed ₹18.5-crore starting prize-pool.

98.title: President Kovind receives 21-gun salute during Naval Fleet in Visakhapatnam
98.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind embarked on the Presidential Yacht INS Sumitra and received a 21-gun salute during the 12th edition of President's Fleet Review at the Eastern Naval Command, Visakhapatnam on Monday. The event was conducted as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav. The President reviewed the Indian Naval Fleet comprising over 60 ships and submarines and 55 aircraft.

99.title: 5 terrorists, 1 soldier killed in Pakistan's North Waziristan
99.article_body: Pakistan's security forces reportedly killed five terrorists in an encounter in North Waziristan on Sunday. One Pakistani soldier was also killed in the incident. "The killed terrorists were involved in terror activities against security forces, target killing and kidnapping for ransom," said officials. A huge cache of arms and ammunition including sub-machine guns and hand grenades was seized.

100.title: Dominican Republic starts building wall along border with Haiti
100.article_body: The Dominican Republic on Sunday started building a wall along the border it shares with Haiti. The 3.9 metres high wall will span nearly half of the 392 km border the two countries share. Dominican President Luis Abinader said the wall would help reduce smuggling of commercial goods, weapons and cross-border human trafficking.

101.title: Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad joins actor for family lunch, pic surfaces
101.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad joined the actor for a family lunch on Sunday, with the actor's uncle Rajesh Roshan sharing a picture on Instagram. Commenting on Rajesh Roshan's picture, Saba Azad wrote, "Bestest Sunday."  Several days ago, Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne Khan had given Saba a shout-out on Instagram Stories for her performance at an event.

102.title: For months I didn't know Muskkaan was Jaaved Jaaferi's sister: Madhuri
102.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit recalled how Muskkaan Jaaferi, who plays her daughter in ‘The Fame Game’, never told her that she’s Jagdeep Jaaferi's daughter and Jaaved Jaaferi’s half-sister. Madhuri said, “We were halfway through the series when I got to know...I was like, ‘Why didn’t you tell me?’” and [Muskkaan] just said, “‘I want to be known as me’,” Madhuri added.

103.title: Andhra minister Mekapati Goutham Reddy passes away after suffering heart attack
103.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Industries and IT Minister Mekapati Goutham Reddy passed away aged 50 on Monday after suffering a heart attack. Reddy was shifted to Apollo Hospitals in Hyderabad, where the doctors declared him brought dead, the hospital said in a release. "CPR was done for more than 90 minutes. Despite our best efforts, he could not be revived," it added.

104.title: I am not hurt at all: Rahul Dravid on Saha making their private conversation public
104.article_body: Reacting to Wriddhiman Saha making his private conversation with Rahul Dravid about getting dropped public, the Team India head coach said, "I am actually not hurt at all. I have a deep respect for Saha and his achievements." Dravid added, "I didn’t want him to hear about [getting dropped] from the media...Sometimes you have difficult conversations with players."

105.title: Wridhi, you just name the person: Harbhajan as Saha shares journalist's threatening texts
105.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a journalist's threatening texts to him after getting dropped from India Test team, former cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Wridhi, you just name the person so that the cricket community knows who operates like this." He added, "Else even the good ones will be put under suspicion...What kind of journalism is this?"

106.title: B'luru engineering student falls 300 feet at Nandi Hills, IAF's Mi17 helicopter saves him
106.article_body: A 19-year-old engineering student from Bengaluru who fell 300 feet into a gorge at Nandi Hills was rescued by the IAF on Sunday. IAF's Mi17 helicopter was launched and a flight gunner was lowered next to the survivor, who helped him harness and lifted him up. Visuals showed the area where Nishank was stuck and how he was lifted up.

107.title: Abhishek to play role of a cricket coach in Balki's 'Ghoomer': Reports
107.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan, who has teamed up with filmmaker R Balki for 'Ghoomer', will be seen playing the role of a cricket coach to Saiyami Kher in the upcoming project, as per reports. In addition to Abhishek and Saiyami, Shabana Azmi and Angad Bedi are also a part of the film, reports stated. 'Ghoomer' went on floors earlier this month.

108.title: Bajrang Dal activist stabbed to death in Shivamogga, sec 144 declared
108.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist, Harsha, was allegedly stabbed to death on Sunday night in Karnataka’s Shivamogga, police said. "Section 144 has been declared in the area," Dr Selvamani R, Deputy Commissioner, Shivamogga said. "As a precautionary measure, schools and colleges in city limits have been closed for two days," Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said.

109.title: Facebook friend drugs woman in Chandigarh hotel, steals ₹10,000; held
109.article_body: Chandigarh police have arrested a man, Robin alias Saurabh, for allegedly cheating a woman in a hotel after befriending her on Facebook. The man reportedly also stole ₹10,000, cell phone and gold jewellery from the woman. Robin reportedly offered intoxicating drink to victim, after which, she felt dizzy and fell unconscious. Police have also recovered fake Aadhaar cards from Robin.

110.title: No political front to be made without Cong: Raut on anti-BJP front
110.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met his Maharashtra counterpart Uddhav Thackeray and NCP chief Sharad Pawar to form an alliance opposing the BJP, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said on Monday that they never said that a political front will be formed without Congress. Furthermore, he said that KCR has the "ability to lead by taking everyone along".

111.title: Mumbai police arrest B'luru man who cheated teacher of ₹2.47 lakh
111.article_body: Mumbai's Matunga police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly cheating a teacher of ₹2.47 lakh under the pretext of providing high returns through a crypto mining scheme. The accused had created an app and promised investors ₹2,000 per day returns, police said. The accused reportedly removed the app from PlayStore after a few days and didn't give any refund.

112.title: 4 of family including 2 kids found dead at home in Kerala; suicide suspected
112.article_body: Four members of a family, including two children, were found dead at their home in Kerala's Thrissur district. Police have recovered a suicide note from the spot which states that they were ending their lives due to financial liability. Prima facie, they seemed to have inhaled some toxic gas to end their lives, according to police.

113.title: Played Sanjay Dutt's mom in 'Rocky' & seduced him in his next film: Aruna
113.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani in an interview recalled how she played Sanjay Dutt's mother in his first film and "seduced him" in the next one. "I still don't understand how people used to accept it in those times and even now," she added. Aruna further said she enjoyed working with Sanjay Dutt. The actor made his debut in 1981 with 'Rocky'.

114.title: Journalists attacked, 20 people detained in Jajpur during panchayat polls
114.article_body: A few journalists were attacked during the third phase of polling in the panchayat elections in Odisha’s Jajpur, Chakravarti Singh Rathore, District Magistrate, Jajpur said. "More than 20 people have been detained. Further detention and arrests are underway," Rathore added. The third phase of Panchayati Raj Institutions (3-tier PRI) polls in Odisha was held on Sunday.

115.title: PM Modi wishes Queen Elizabeth II speedy recovery from COVID-19
115.article_body: A day after 95-year-old UK's Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19, Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished her a speedy recovery. "I wish Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth a speedy recovery and pray for her good health," said Modi in a tweet. Earlier, Buckingham Palace said, "Her Majesty is experiencing mild cold-like symptoms but expects to continue light duties."

116.title: Big B thanks Prabhas for bringing him home-cooked food, says 'beyond delicious'
116.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan, who is currently shooting for his next with Prabhas, took to Twitter on Sunday and thanked the 'Bahubali' star for home-cooked food. Amitabh tweeted, "Bahubali Prabhas...your generosity is beyond measure...you bring me home-cooked food [which is] beyond delicious...you send me quantity beyond measure [that] could have fed an army...the special cookies...[are] beyond scrumptious."

117.title: ITBP Constable shoots self dead in Delhi, suicide note found
117.article_body: A 31-year-old Indo-Tibetan Border Police personnel allegedly shot himself dead using his service rifle on Sunday, officials said. Constable Y Reddy, who was on security duty at Delhi's Teen Murti Bhavan, had returned around two weeks ago after a 30-day leave. A purported suicide note was recovered where he accused his wife and father-in-law of mentally harassing him, officials added.

118.title: 24-yr-old woman arrested for getting her mother killed in south Delhi
118.article_body: A 24-yr-old woman has been arrested for getting her mother killed with the help of a man in south Delhi. The deceased, identified as 55-year-old Sudha Rani, was found lying covered in blood at her house in Madangir when police reached the scene on February 19. Officers found that Ms Rani was given sleeping pills before her throat was slit.

119.title: Man dies, brother injured in workshop fire in Delhi’s Dwarka
119.article_body: A 24-year-old man died and his elder brother suffered severe injuries after a fire broke out in a furniture workshop in Delhi's Dwarka on Sunday. According to officials, the fire was caused after a chemical drum exploded due to a short circuit. Two fire tenders reached the spot and doused the fire. The survivor is being treated at Safdarjung hospital.

120.title: Kejriwal buying votes by taking money from Khalistanis: BJP’s Adesh Gupta
120.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was "buying votes by taking money from Khalistanis." "He (Kejriwal) is agreeing with whatever they say...He now calls himself the sweetest terrorist and it's right because he included in AAP those involved in Delhi riots," Gupta added.

121.title: If not Bhagavad Gita, should kids recite Fatawa-e-Allamgiri: Rane
121.article_body: BJP leader Nitesh Rane wrote to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray over issue of recitation of Bhagavad Gita in BMC schools. "There is no doubt that recitation of Bhagavad Gita will help kids in the process of developing their personality. But if there is opposition to reciting Gita then should we ask our kids to recite Aurangzeb's Fatawa-e-Allamgiri?" Nitesh said.

122.title: Hijab protesters missing exams may not be allowed to reappear: K'taka official
122.article_body: Students protesting the hijab ban might not be allowed to reappear for the pre-university practical exams, starting Monday, if they miss it, a senior government official said. The exams were to start from February 17 but were postponed amid the hijab controversy, the official added. "The state has not issued any written notification in this regard," the official stated.

123.title: Death toll from flash floods and landslides rises to 152 in Brazil
123.article_body: The death toll from flash floods and landslides, triggered by torrential rains, in Brazil's Petrópolis rose to 152, authorities said on Sunday. Around 165 people still remain missing in the colonial city, according to the police. "I express my closeness to those people hit in previous days by natural calamities," Pope Francis said.

124.title: India reports 16,051 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 20% less than yesterday
124.article_body: India has reported 16,051 new COVID-19 cases and 206 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 19,968 cases and 673 deaths. India's daily positivity rate rose from 1.68% to 1.93% while the number of active cases declined to 2,02,131.

125.title: Time for BCCI President to dive in: Shastri on journalist's threatening texts to Saha
125.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared threatening WhatsApp texts he received from a journalist, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Shocking a player being threatened by a journo." He added, "Blatant position abuse...Something that's happening too frequently with #TeamIndia. Time for...BCCI President...to dive in. Find out who the person is in interest of every cricketer. This is serious coming from ultimate team man."

126.title: 1 dead, 3 injured as speeding truck hits 2 cars, crashes into hotel in Guj
126.article_body: One person died and three others sustained injuries when a speeding truck lost control and hit two cars before crashing into a hotel in Palanpur in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. "The three injured were rushed to the Civil Hospital in Palanpur...The accident caused considerable damage to the front portion of Hotel Savera," a senior police officer said.

127.title: Today's girls, boys taught conduct in industry; we didn't have that: Deepika
127.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said today's 'girls and boys' are prepared when they enter the industry. "They are told how to stand, sit...how to conduct themselves, what to say, what not to say...what to wear, what not to wear, how they should do their hair...we didn't have any of that. We grew into it, we made...mistakes along way," she said.

128.title: Ranveer Singh gets Best Actor at DPIFF, Kriti Sanon bags Best Actress
128.article_body: Ranveer Singh was named Best Actor for '83', while Kriti Sanon bagged the Best Actress award for 'Mimi' at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards 2022 (DPIFF). The awards for Critics Best Actress and Critics Best Actor went to Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra for 'Shershaah'. Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards 2022 was held in Mumbai on Sunday.

129.title: Childless elderly couple dies by suicide in Tamil Nadu
129.article_body: An elderly couple died by suicide in Tamil Nadu after allegedly being "lonely". Deceased, 76-year-old Nambirajan, who was retired official of a private company, and 76-year-old Pappa, who was retired teacher, were childless. Police said couple was worried about their health and absence of a permanent caregiver. Nambirajan's brother said couple had earlier spoken about having suicidal tendencies.

130.title: It was a bold decision to not to star opposite Ranbir in 'Rocket...': Gauahar
130.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan said her choices as an actor have been quite wise. She added, "When I started out with 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of The Year', it was a...bold decision in itself not to be opposite Ranbir (Kapoor) but to portray a girl who stood out in the entire script." Gauahar said she was trained well with her first film.

131.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Pune; 6 arrested
131.article_body: Six persons were arrested when a cricket betting racket was busted in Pune's Gultekdi area. They were allegedly involved in betting on the India-West Indies T-20 International series. The police said they seized cash, laptop and other items worth ₹ 7.21 lakh during the raid. They also recovered a SIM card which was allegedly used to accept bets.

132.title: Kerala sees 3-fold rise in very heavy rainfall incidences since 2015: IMD data
132.article_body: Around a three-fold increase was witnessed in incidences of very heavy rainfall across the districts of Kerala since 2015, according to the IMD’s data. The coastal state witnessed 43 very heavy rainfall events in 2015, which increased to 115 in 2021. Very heavy rainfall events are categorised as days that experience rainfall between 115.6 mm and 204.4 mm.

133.title: 67-yr-old Mumbai woman files complaint against son for cheating her of ₹40 lakh
133.article_body: A 67-year-old woman in Mumbai's Santacruz has lodged a complaint against her son for allegedly cheating her of ₹40 lakh. The woman claimed her son had allegedly offered to sell her one-room flat and buy a new house in her name so he could shift there with his family. Later, she found out that the flat was in his name.

134.title: 3 persons called for inquiry into POCSO Act case attack Pune police
134.article_body: Three people allegedly attacked police at an outpost in Pune who had called them for an inquiry into a Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act case. The accused reportedly threw and tore papers related to the inquiry and attacked the staff, a police official said. Of the three accused, two men were arrested while the woman is absconding.

135.title: Biden, Putin agree to meet only if Russia does not invade Ukraine
135.article_body: US President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin have accepted in principle to hold a summit to discuss "security and strategic stability in Europe," the French presidency has announced. The meeting can only happen if Russia does not invade Ukraine. The summit proposed by France President Emmanuel Macron will be expanded to relevant stakeholders, the official statement said.

136.title: Kidnapper offered lift to child in November, probe on: Pune police
136.article_body: A four-year-old child, who was abducted on January 11 and released hours later, was given a lift by the kidnapper two months before the incident in November, Pune police has said. "The kidnapper had given the child a lift in November. We have prepared a sketch and further investigation is on in the case," said police.

137.title: Suryakumar Yadav's celebration after scoring fifty goes viral
137.article_body: Team India middle-order batter Suryakumar Yadav's celebration after scoring a fifty in the third T20I against West Indies has gone viral on social media. The 31-year-old raised his bat and then bowed and folded his hands in 'Namaste' gesture. Suryakumar slammed 65 runs off 31 deliveries in the match, including seven sixes and a four.

138.title: Gym set up for personnel at Hyderabad's Karkhana police station
138.article_body: A gym was inaugurated at the Karkhana police station in Hyderabad on Saturday. The gym is reportedly equipped with yoga mats, cycling machine and treadmill. An official reportedly said that being fit is important for law enforcement officers and that the police personnel are being urged to spend at least one hour in the gym every day.

139.title: B'luru food delivery staff educated on traffic rules, wearing safe helmets
139.article_body: Bengaluru traffic police officials conducted an awareness programme with the food delivery staff at food stations. They were reportedly educated to ensure that they wear high-quality and safe helmets. The police also conducted the programme to ensure that the food delivery staff are aware of compliance with traffic rules. The police held a safe-helmet programme with other motorists too.

140.title: 8-yr-old boy dies after falling from balcony of high-rise building in Faridabad
140.article_body: An eight-year-old boy died after allegedly falling from the balcony of his flat in a high-rise building at a residential society in Faridabad. The boy was standing on a chair and leaning against the balcony's railing when he lost his balance and fell, police said. "It appears he was leaning over...to see the children who were playing," an officer said.

141.title: Did my hair, wear own clothes; didn't have PR agent: Deepika on early career
141.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said she had no PR agent or manager when she made debut in film industry. "I did my own hair and makeup, I used to wear my own clothes," she said, adding, "Today, girls and boys are completely prepared...They are told how to stand, how to sit, how to conduct themselves...we didn't have any of that."

142.title: 'Rags to Bags' exhibition in Bhayandar aims to reduce plastic use
142.article_body: The Mira Bhayandar Municipal Corporation (MBMC) has organised a 'Rags to Bags' exhibition with an aim to encourage people to replace plastic bags with eco-friendly ones. The two-day exhibition was inaugurated on Saturday at the Maxus Mall in Bhayandar (west) by mayor Jyotsna Hasnale.  The recycled bags displayed at the exhibition were manufactured by local Women Self Help Groups (SHG).

143.title: EC takes suo moto cognisance of poll code violation by Akhilesh
143.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) on Sunday took suo motu cognisance of violation of the Model Code of Conduct by Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav in UP. Yadav, who cast his vote for the Jaswantnagar seat, had allegedly interacted and shared his opinions with media personnel outside the polling booth. A complaint had been submitted against him earlier in Saifai.

144.title: 18 FIRs filed across Punjab during polls: Chief Electoral Officer
144.article_body: A total of 18 First Information Reports (FIRs) were registered across Punjab during the assembly polls on Sunday, Punjab Chief Electoral Officer S Karuna Raju said. He added, that the incidents were all minor and that the FIRs had been filed to avoid any untoward incidents. He further said, "The election was peaceful. It was like a festival here."

145.title: 19,000 Cong workers went to jail for people in 1.5 yrs: Priyanka
145.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli, Congress general secretary Priyanka Vadra said that 19,000 Congress workers went to jail for the people in the last 1.5 years. Congress will empower women if elected, she added. "We will waive off farmers' loans as in Chhattisgarh, halve the electricity bills," Vadra further said.

146.title: 5 people booked on charges of gang-rape, extortion in Punjab
146.article_body: Five people have been booked by police on the charges of gang-rape and extortion in Punjab. The charges come after a woman was reportedly gang-raped on February 16 after being taken to a deserted place at gunpoint by five people, who came in a car. The accused have been charged under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

147.title: India seen as powerful country because of BJP govt: Rajnath Singh
147.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Patti, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that people across the world look at India as a powerful country because of the BJP government's achievements. Singh stated that UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has done everything for the development of the state. "Yogi Adityanath is a more successful minister than me," he added.

148.title: Plot to deny education to Muslim girls: Ex-K'taka CM on hijab ban
148.article_body: Former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Sunday said that the hijab ban was BJP's conspiracy to prevent Muslim girls from getting an education. "The code of uniform should have been prescribed at beginning of the session. Hijab ban in educational institutions in the month of January-February is deliberate and intentional," he further added.

149.title: Tripura Police bring back 2 con men after arresting them in Bihar
149.article_body: The Tripura Police brought back two con men to Agartala on Sunday after arresting them in Bihar where they were hiding. The accused were traced before a Crime Branch Unit team travelled to Bihar and arrested them in collaboration with local police. Speaking about the amount involved, police said, "As per...scheme, ₹5,000 was entitled to each of the beneficiaries."

150.title: 2022 a chance to see how ready I'm to win gold at 2024 Olympics: Lovlina
150.article_body: Boxer Lovlina Borgohain, who won a bronze medal at Tokyo Olympics, said she's more confident to do better at 2024 Paris Olympics. She added that World Championships, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games this year will give her an opportunity to check how ready she is and how much more she should do to win a gold medal at 2024 Olympics.

151.title: Kejriwal wants to rule, even if it means breaking the nation: Punjab CM
151.article_body: As single-phase voting for the 117-seat Punjab Assembly ended on Sunday, Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi said, "Kejriwal wants to rule, even if it means breaking the nation." He added, "Arvind Kejriwal has taken support from Khalistani outfits...from those who want to divide the nation...those who are against the country. This support is very dangerous."

152.title: Who was Gangubai Kathiawadi & what's the controversy around the movie on her?
152.article_body: Ganga Harjeevandas (aka Gangubai) Kathiawadi from Gujarat became popular as one of Mumbai's well-known and influential brothel owners in the 50s and 60s. She's known to have lobbied for commercial sex workers' rights and her adopted children have objected to her portrayal as a prostitute in her biopic. One of them said it affected reputation of his family's women members.

153.title: Nigerian airstrike leaves 7 children dead in Niger: Governor
153.article_body: An airstrike by Nigeria's military left 12 people, including seven children, dead and five others injured in neighbouring Niger, the Governor of Maradi said on Sunday. The attack took place in Nachadé village on Friday, a few kilometres from the border with Nigeria, the Governor added. The attack was aimed at bandits in the area, the Governor further said.

154.title: Police in Nepal fire tear gas to disperse protest over US grant
154.article_body: Police in Nepal's Kathmandu fired tear gas and water cannons on protesters who took to the streets to oppose a US-funded infrastructure programme that was presented for ratification in parliament on Sunday. Demonstrators rallied against a US government agency's $500 million grant, which would be used to fund civic projects, on grounds that it may undermine Nepal's laws and sovereignty.

155.title: Delhi records 570 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in the last 24 hrs
155.article_body: Delhi reported 570 new COVID-19 cases and four related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,56,071. Moreover, 730 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 2,545 active cases. With four more deaths, the fatality count in Delhi has reached 26,101.

156.title: Dhull becomes 3rd Indian cricketer to score tons in each innings on Ranji Trophy debut
156.article_body: India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Yash Dhull has become the third Indian cricketer after Nari Contractor and Virag Awate to score hundreds in each innings on Ranji Trophy debut. The 19-year-old right-handed batter scored 113(150) innings and hit 113*(202) in the second innings. Dhull is overall the ninth batter to score hundreds in both innings of first-class debut.

157.title: Mehmood made my career & was also responsible for my downfall: Aruna
157.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani said, "People misunderstood that I got married to Mehmood and at that time, I didn't even try to clear things in public." She added she did not get films for around two years despite 'Caravan' and 'Bombay To Goa' being successful. "It's like Mehmood made my career and...was also responsible for my downfall," she jokingly said.

158.title: All indications Russia on brink of invading Ukraine: US Secy of State
158.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday said all signs suggested Russia is on brink of invading Ukraine but pledged to use every opportunity to stop Russia from going forth with it. This comes as Russia deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops near Ukraine. President Joe Biden was also prepared to engage with Russian President Vladimir Putin, added Blinken.

159.title: Saha shouldn’t have made private conversation with Sourav public: Snehasish Ganguly
159.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha made his private conversation with BCCI President Sourav Ganguly public, Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) secretary Snehasish Ganguly said, "He shouldn't have gone public with that." Saha had revealed that after he scored 61* against New Zealand in Kanpur in November 2021, Sourav texted him on WhatsApp saying, "As long as I'm here...you'd be in the team."

160.title: India tells families of embassy officials to leave Ukraine: Reports
160.article_body: Amid growing fears of the Russian invasion over Ukraine, India on Sunday told families of its embassy officials to return to the country, as per multiple reports. The Indian embassy in Kyiv had earlier today told all Indian students and Indian nationals whose stay isn't deemed essential to leave Ukraine temporarily. Students were asked to contact their student contractors.

161.title: Kamal opts out of Bigg Boss Ultimate due to clash with Vikram
161.article_body: South Indian actor Kamal Haasan has opted out of Bigg Boss Ultimate as his dates were overlapping with the "production and post-production" of his upcoming film 'Vikram'. "Considering the fact that some more days of shoot are left...it has become practically impossible to manage both Vikram and Bigg Boss together," the actor said in a statement.

162.title: I'm getting to point where I'm missing acting a little bit: Ben
162.article_body: Hollywood actor Ben Stiller has said that he is getting to a point where he is missing acting "a little bit". "It's been a few years [since I acted]. It hasn't been totally intentional except I really do enjoy directing and producing," he stated. "Lately, I've been exploring projects [and] making things as a director and producer," he added.

163.title: Mumbai logs 167 COVID-19 cases & no deaths in the last 24 hrs
163.article_body: Mumbai reported 167 new COVID-19 cases and no related deaths in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 286 COVID-19 recoveries were reported in Mumbai with the city currently having 1,511 active cases. Maharashtra reported 1,437 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, taking the overall infection tally in the state to 78,58,431. Active cases in the state stand at 16,422.

164.title: Pakistan arrests 31 Indian fishermen, seizes 5 fishing boats
164.article_body: The Pakistan Maritime Security Agency (PMSA) on Sunday said that it has arrested 31 Indian fishermen and seized five boats for fishing in the country's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). The arrests were made on Friday, the PMSA announced. The boats were towed to Karachi for further legal proceedings, the agency added.

165.title: Russian minister to speak to France's Le Drian on Feb 21: Report
165.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will speak with his French counterpart, Jean-Yves Le Drian over phone on February 21, said TASS news agency citing Russian Foreign Ministry. This comes as Russian President Vladimir Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron held talks over a diplomatic solution to Ukrainian crisis on Sunday. Meanwhile, Russia deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops near Ukraine.

166.title: India win their 9th T20I in a row, complete their 2nd straight T20I series whitewash
166.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 17 runs in the third T20I at Eden Gardens in Kolkata to register a 3-0 series whitewash. With this, India extended their winning streak in T20I cricket to nine matches. Further, India completed their second straight T20I series whitewash after having defeated New Zealand 3-0 in their previous T20I series.

167.title: Kasautii's 44-yr-old actor Cezanne to marry girlfriend, says 'No perfect age to get married'
167.article_body: Cezanne Khan, the 44-year-old actor best known for playing Anurag Basu in 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', told TOI that he's planning to marry his girlfriend Afsheen this year. "We've been together for three years now...Had it not been for the pandemic, we would've been married by now," Khan said. "I feel there is no perfect age to get married," he added.

168.title: Ship with 4,000 luxury cars still burning mid-ocean as firefighters continue ops
168.article_body: A port official has said that firefighters are struggling to douse a fire that broke out on a vessel carrying thousands of luxury cars on Wednesday in the Atlantic Ocean. The Felicity Ace ship was carrying around 4,000 vehicles including Porsches and Audis, and some electric cars with lithium-ion batteries. It was not clear whether the batteries sparked the fire.

169.title: Govt to 'scrupulously' carry out background check of Air India's new CEO: Report
169.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) will "scrupulously" carry out a thorough background check of Air India's new CEO and MD Ilker Ayci, a Turkish national, PTI reported. Tata Group named Turkish Airlines' former Chairman Ayci as Air India's CEO. MHA carries out a thorough background check of all foreign nationals when they're appointed in the key positions, PTI added.

170.title: Father figure: Ajay Jadeja on Rohit giving up opening spot in 3rd T20I
170.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has praised Rohit Sharma after he gave up his opening spot to Ruturaj Gaikwad in India-West Indies third and final T20I, saying the India captain is a "magnanimous man". He added, "He's (Rohit) looking at this team like a father figure...he wants these new kids to get a better opportunity." Rohit batted at number four.

171.title: Italy recommends 4th COVID-19 shot for people with low immunity
171.article_body: Italian Health Ministry on Sunday recommended a fourth COVID-19 vaccine shot for individuals with a severely compromised immunity. People who have taken their first booster shot at least 120 days prior are eligible to take the next one, the ministry said. Booster doses have shown efficacy in preventing symptoms that would require hospitalisation and COVID-related fatalities, it added.

172.title: Israel to allow entry of unvaccinated tourists from March 1: PM
172.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett on Sunday announced that Israel would allow unvaccinated tourists to enter the country from March 1. The tourists would be required to take COVID-19 tests before their flights and upon landing, he added. "We are seeing a constant decline in morbidity data, so it is time to gradually open up," he further said.

173.title: Sidhu & Majithia meet at Punjab poll booth, exchange pleasantries
173.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu exchanged brief pleasantries with his rival Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia after the two came face to face at a polling booth entrance in Amritsar. Sidhu and Majithia are both contesting the Amritsar East assembly seat. Majithia also shared a warm hug with BJP candidate Jagmohan Singh Raju at the venue.

174.title: US, UAE seek additional $4 bn in farming climate change investment
174.article_body: US Secretary of Agriculture Thomas Vilsack on Sunday said US, UAE pushed for additional $4 billion investment in Agriculture Innovation Mission for Climate (AIM for Climate) to make agriculture resilient to climate change. This comes after $4 billion investment was sought following its launch by both countries in November 2021. Aimed at climate-friendly farming, AIM is backed by 140 partners.

175.title: Pakistan PM to visit Russia on Feb 23-24 for 1st time in 23 years
