175.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will visit Russia on February 23-24 making the first visit by a Pakistan PM since 1999, Kremlin Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov said. Peskov added Khan will also visit Russian President Vladimir Putin. This comes after Islamabad and Moscow reportedly held talks last month to finalise a plan for President Putin's visit to Pakistan.

176.title: Akhilesh Yadav is today's Aurangzeb: Madhya Pradesh CM
176.article_body: Addressing a poll rally in UP's Deoria, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan compared Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav to Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb. "Akhilesh is today's Aurangzeb. One who wasn't loyal to his father, how will he be (loyal) to you," Chouhan said. "Mulayam (Singh Yadav) also said that no one has humiliated him the way Akhilesh did," he added.

177.title: New policy to cut green hydrogen cost by 40-50%: India's largest oil firm IOC
177.article_body: India's largest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has said that the offer to waive transmission charges on green energy will help cut the cost of manufacturing green hydrogen by 40-50%. The cost will go down further if electrolyzers are indigenously manufactured instead of the present practice of importing them, said Director for Research & Development S.S.V. Ramakumar.

178.title: 'Parivarvadis' spreading venom in name of caste: PM Modi in Hardoi
178.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing an election rally at Hardoi, UP, on Sunday said that the "parivarvadis" are "now spreading venom in the name of caste". He said this after accusing Samajwadi Party, which was in power in the state until 2017, of not letting him work for UP. "Such people fight with their own family for chair," he added.

179.title: Haven't spoken to them about my role in IPL: Wade on Gujarat Titans
179.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade, who was bought by Gujarat Titans for ₹2.4 crore in IPL 2022 mega auction, said he hasn't spoken to franchise about his role in IPL 2022. "But I would assume anywhere from opening down to seven I'm pretty comfortable with. It doesn't worry me too much," he added. Wade had a base price of ₹2 crore.

180.title: Israel names retired military general as new cyber security chief
180.article_body: Israel's cabinet on Sunday named retired military general Gaby Portnoy to head the country's National Cyber Directorate, the Prime Minister's Office said. 52-year-old Portnoy will head the country's main body charged with defending the cyberspace and ramping up its cyber strength. Portnoy served for 31 years in the armed forces before retiring as Brigadier-General of Israel Defense Forces.

181.title: Aarya Babbar argues with pilot after getting called to cockpit over a joke
181.article_body: Actor Aarya Babbar shared a video of a heated exchange he had with the pilot of the flight he was in. Babbar said he was called to the cockpit for cracking a joke. He's heard telling the pilot, "You wish to show your power...you want me to get up from my seat...come...talk to you when you have a problem."

182.title: 4 senior executives at Better.com resign amid reports of more layoffs in March
182.article_body: Four more senior executives of Better.com have resigned, three months after the company fired 900 employees over a Zoom call. The latest resignations include Clayton Carol, VP of Finance; Christian Wallace, Head of Real Estate; Paul Tyger, General Manager of Purchase; and Stephen Rosen, Head of Sales. Reports suggest that the company is preparing for a massive layoff next month.

183.title: It's been therapeutic: Taapsee on wrap of 'Woh Ladki Hai Kahaan'
183.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu on Sunday announced the wrap of her film 'Woh Ladki Hai Kahaan' on Instagram, calling it a therapeutic experience. The actress shared a series of monochrome pictures from the sets of the film, writing, "I had a blast being the badass ACP Komal Sharma!" The Arshad Syed directorial co-stars Pratik Gandhi and Prateik Babbar.

184.title: Enjoyed his batting more than mine: Venkatesh on Suryakumar's 65(31)
184.article_body: Praising teammate Suryakumar Yadav for his 31-ball 65 in India-West Indies third and final T20I, India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer (35*) said he enjoyed Suryakumar's batting more than his. Venkatesh and Suryakumar stitched a 37-ball 91-run fifth wicket stand to help India post 184/5 in 20 overs. "Every shot of his (Suryakumar's) has a touch of grace," Venkatesh added.

185.title: Four Chinese fighter planes enter Taiwan's air defence zone
185.article_body: Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense said four fighter jets of China's People's Liberation Army Air Force entered Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) on Friday. While Taiwanese air force issued radio warnings to Chinese jets, the military deployed air defence missile systems to monitor Chinese jets. Taiwan is a self-governed nation near China which China claims as its own territory.

186.title: Love Kangana's guts, but I'm not made for it: Surbhi on 'Lock Upp'
186.article_body: Actress Surbhi Chandna, speaking about being a part of the reality television show 'Lock Upp' hosted by actress Kangana Ranaut, said that she is not made for such things. The actress further said that she is extremely fond of Kangana and loves her guts. "If I get a chance I will watch it...this is an epic combination," Surbhi added.

187.title: Punjab will be Cong-free for 100 yrs due to Gandhi family: AAP candidate
187.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) candidate Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh said on Sunday that Congress will be wiped out from Punjab. He added that party won't return to power for next 100 years due to the Gandhi family. Singh, who contested Assembly polls from Amritsar North, further said CM Charanjit Singh Channi's government has been "a flop show of 111 days".

188.title: PM Modi stops BJP leader from touching his feet at poll rally, video surfaces
188.article_body: PM Narendra Modi stopped BJP's Unnao District President Awadhesh Katiyar from touching his feet during a poll rally in Uttar Pradesh. In a video of PM's rally speech shared by BJP, Katiyar is seen bending down to touch PM's feet after presenting him with an idol of Lord Rama. PM is seen signalling Katiyar to stop.

189.title: Sehwag shares Rohit's 'Chal udhar bhaag' pic over journalist's threatening texts to Saha
189.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share Rohit Sharma's viral 'Chal udhar bhaag' picture after Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of threatening WhatsApp texts from a journalist. "What I would have done and what Wriddhi should be doing next time the so called journalist dares to message him," Sehwag wrote alongside the picture.

190.title: Singers Sumedha Karmahe, Geet Sagar divorced in 2018: Report
190.article_body: Singers Sumedha Karmahe and Geet Sagar, who got married on July 11, 2016, got divorced in 2018 two years after their wedding, reported Hindustan Times. As per the report, the two never spoke about it but have confirmed the divorce now. "Yes, we are divorced...I wouldn't want to talk more about it," Sumedha said. Geet called it painful and hurtful.

191.title: We haven't been able to change party number image: Meet Bros
191.article_body: Musical duo Meet Bros, comprising Harmeet and Manmeet Singh, said they have been unable to change their "party number" image, despite composing several romantic songs. "[Image] breaks if you pick up an award," Harmeet said. "There's something called rage, songs that spread like wildfire...That's when your image changes," Manmeet Singh stated.

192.title: Quite a gesture from Rohit to let Ishan open with Gaikwad: Bhogle on 3rd T20I
192.article_body: Talking about India's innings in third T20I against West Indies, commentator Harsha Bhogle said it was quite a gesture from captain Rohit Sharma to let Ishan Kishan open innings with Ruturaj Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who is playing in his third T20I, scored four and Kishan hit 34, while Rohit batted at number four. India set a 185-run target for West Indies.

193.title: 16-yr-old girl on way to school raped in Jaipur, suspect arrested
193.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a youth in Jaipur while she was on her way to school. The victim alleged that she was sexually assaulted after a youth approached her and took her to an abandoned place. The police said that the accused was apprehended as soon as the teenage girl filed a complaint.

194.title: Disha Patani announces wrap on 'Ek Villain Returns', shares pics
194.article_body: Actress Disha Patani on Sunday took to Instagram Stories to announce a wrap on her film 'Ek Villain Returns' sharing pictures with her team. The Mohit Suri directorial also stars John Abraham, Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria. John had finished shooting for 'Ek Villain Returns' in October 2021 and had called it a beautiful and seamless experience.

195.title: Whenever Rajinikanth & I finalise a film, I will announce: Boney
195.article_body: Taking to Twitter, producer Boney Kapoor dismissed the rumours of him collaborating with South Indian actor Rajinikanth. "Whenever we finalise a film to work together on, I shall be the first person to announce it. You will not have to get such 'leaked ideas'," Boney tweeted. The reports had stated that Boney will produce Rajinikanth's 170th film.

196.title: 2 J'khand workers killed, 2 hurt in boiler blast at TN prawn farm
196.article_body: Two Jharkhand labourers have died and two others have been seriously injured after a steam boiler at a prawn farm in Tamil Nadu exploded. The accident is said to have occurred at a private prawn farm in Thoduvai village near Sirkazhi around 12 pm on Sunday. A case has been registered by the Sirkazhi police and further investigation is underway.

197.title: Trump's social media 'Truth Social' app likely to be released tomorrow: Report
197.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's social media app 'Truth Social' is expected to launch in Apple's App Store on Monday, as per Reuters. The app will mark Trump's return to social media after he was banned from Twitter, Facebook and YouTube last year following the attack on Capitol on January 6. The app pledged to deliver a "censorship-free experience".

198.title: I was dancing when Jersey's new release date was announced: Mrunal
198.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said that she was happy when the makers of 'Jersey' announced the new release date. "I was literally dancing. But I am more nervous because the release is coming closer," she stated. 'Jersey' will release on April 14. 'Jersey' was set to release on December 31, however, it got postponed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases.

199.title: 63.44% voter turnout in Punjab; 57.58% in UP polls' 3rd phase till 5 pm
199.article_body: A voter turnout of 63.44% was recorded in Punjab till 5 pm while UP's third phase of polling witnessed a turnout of 57.58% on Sunday. In Punjab, the highest turnout was reported in Mansa constituency at 73.45%, followed by Malerkotla at 72.84%. In UP, the highest turnout was reported in Lalitpur at 67.38%, followed by 62.02% in Mahoba, PTI reported.

200.title: Only Nadal can beat Medvedev, even Novak easily lost to Russian: Opelka
200.article_body: World number 20 Reilly Opelka said only Rafael Nadal is capable of beating Daniil Medvedev as Novak Djokovic was easily beaten by the world number two at 2021 US Open. The Spaniard beat Medvedev at 2022 Australian Open to win his 21st Grand Slam title, the most in men's singles. Opelka lost to Medvedev at 2021 French Open third round.

201.title: Mysuru college cancels uniform rule to allow students with hijab
201.article_body: A private college in Mysuru has cancelled the uniform rule prescribed by Karnataka High Court, which bans hijabs, saffron shawls or any religious clothing inside classrooms. DDPU announced that it was cancelling its uniform rule to allow Muslim girls to attend classes wearing headscarves. The college is said to be the first in the state to take this decision.

202.title: BJP to call 72-hr bandh if WB civic polls voting blocked: Suvendu
202.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari warned the TMC-led government of a 72-hour bandh if voting is blocked on February 27, the day of West Bengal civic polls. While campaigning in Bengal, Adhikari said, "Everything will be blocked after 6 pm in Nimtala, Maniktala...other areas," if voting is blocked.  BJP has earlier claimed several instances of candidates being intimidated or threatened.

203.title: IPL media rights valuation will mirror rise, growth of league: Jay Shah
203.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said IPL media rights "will mirror rise and growth of league", especially after the addition of two new teams and strong digital growth. He added that BCCI will float tenders for expanded league's media rights for 2023-27 cycle as early as coming week. Star India, owned by Walt Disney Company, paid ₹163.48 billion for 2018-22 cycle.

204.title: How does the medal tally read after the Winter Olympics 2022 ends?
204.article_body: The Winter Olympics 2022 came to an end in Beijing on Sunday. Norway led the medal tally with 16 golds, eight silvers and 13 bronze medals. Germany finished second and host China finished third. China was followed by the US, Sweden, the Netherlands, Austria, Switzerland and ROC. Skier Arif Khan, India's only candidate at the games, didn't win a medal.

205.title: Katrina and I had mix of both cultures in our early days: Deepika
205.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said that she didn't have a PR agent or manager in her early days, adding that she along with Katrina Kaif had a mixture of both cultures. "I did my own hair and makeup, I used to wear my own clothes," Deepika said. She added that the PR culture came in and they adapted to it.

206.title: Can't forget that moment: PM Modi on 2008 Ahmedabad blasts
206.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while campaigning in UP's Hardoi on Sunday, recalled the 2008 Ahmedabad blasts that occurred when he was Gujarat CM, saying he "can't forget that moment". He added, "I'd pledged my government will find these people and punish them, even from hell." On Friday, a Special Court sentenced 38 people to death for the blasts that killed 56.

207.title: Malta PM Abela calls for parliamentary elections on March 26
207.article_body: Malta's PM and Leader of Labour Party Robert Abela on Sunday said the country will hold parliamentary elections on March 26. "The future is bright because we're strong in the present," Abela addressed a rally near capital Valletta. While the results will be declared on March 27, opinion polls predict a successive third term for Abela's centre-left Labour Party.

208.title: CM-candidate insecure about his seat: PM Modi on Akhilesh Yadav
208.article_body: Criticising SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "If the chief ministerial candidate himself is insecure about his constituency, you can gauge the direction of the wind." "The seat, which these people considered as the safest, is also getting out of their reach," he added. Yadav is contesting the 2022 UP Assembly election from the Karhal constituency.

209.title: Russia and France agree to work for East Ukraine ceasefire amid clashes
209.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin agreed in a call on Sunday to work for a ceasefire in eastern Ukraine where pro-Russia separatists and Ukrainian forces clashed in recent days. They also agreed on "the need to find a diplomatic solution to the ongoing crisis and to do everything to achieve one", Macron's office said.

210.title: 'Exceptionally rare' 15.10-carat blue diamond to be auctioned in Hong Kong
210.article_body: A 15.10-carat blue diamond described as "exceptionally rare" will be auctioned by Sotheby's in Hong Kong in April. It's the largest vivid blue diamond ever to appear at an auction and also one of the most valuable blue diamonds, Sotheby's said. Only five blue diamonds over 10 carats have ever come to auction, none of which have exceeded 15 carats.

211.title: When I read 'The Marvels', I was like this is bonkers: Brie Larson
211.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, who portrays Captain Marvel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has said that when she first read the script of 'The Marvels', she couldn't believe what she was reading. "I was like, this is bonkers," the actress added. Brie further said that the thing that she loves about Marvel is that they continue to reinvent.

212.title: Russia, Cuba to strengthen ties amid Ukraine crisis: Cuban govt
212.article_body: Cuban foreign ministry on Friday said Russia, Cuba will deepen ties and explore collaboration in transportation, energy following a visit by Russian Deputy Prime Minister Yury Borisov. "Cuba reiterates its position against unilateral and unjust sanctions imposed by the West on the Eurasian country..." stated the ministry. Meanwhile, tensions remain high between the West and Russia over Ukraine.

213.title: Nicole Kidman features on 'Vanity Fair' cover, fans call pic 'photoshopped'
213.article_body: 'Vanity Fair' took to Instagram to share its recent cover featuring actress Nicole Kidman along with a video of her photoshoot. The cover showed Kidman wearing a black mini skirt along with a bra top to which several users commented that the image had been photoshopped. "The airbrushing on her face makes her look like another person," commented a fan.

214.title: ECI restores number of star campaigners as COVID-19 cases decline
214.article_body: Amid decline in COVID-19 infections, Election Commission of India (ECI) on Sunday decided to restore the maximum limit of star campaigners for ongoing and future elections. Recognised national and state-level parties can field maximum of 40 campaigners, while other registered parties can field 20 campaigners. List of additional campaigners may be submitted to ECI by 5 pm on February 23.

215.title: We could've done better in the T20I series vs Australia: Shanaka
215.article_body: Following a 4-1 loss against Australia in the T20I series, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "The boys played...well throughout the series, they made a clear statement." "Unfortunately, we missed a few players in between, we could have done better this series," he added. Sri Lanka avoided a series whitewash against Australia after winning the fifth T20I by five wickets.

216.title: Brain's processing speed remains high until age 60: German study
216.article_body: German researchers found brain's processing speed remains high till age 60. Team analysed over 10 lakh participants and measured their reaction times to a cognitive task. Researchers said slow response times were due to increases in decision caution, slower body movement. Earlier, people had attributed the slower response to mental speed which was believed to have peaked at age 20.

217.title: It's time to implement sanctions against Russia: Ukraine to West
217.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Sunday said that it's time for the West to implement at least part of the sanctions it has prepared against Russia. "Russia has to be stopped right now. We see how events are unfolding," he added. Notably, Kuleba made the comment after Russia and Belarus announced an extension of their military drills near Ukraine.

218.title: Tata Technologies to hire 1,000 more people in FY 2023: CEO
218.article_body: Tata Technologies will hire at least 1,000 more people in FY2023 than its planned recruitment of over 3,000 innovators over 12 months under its expanded talent acquisition program, said CEO Warren Harris. "That speaks to the fact that increasingly, we are not opportunities constrained," he added. The company had announced its decision to recruit over 3,000 people in January.

219.title: Djokovic should either get vaccinated or stay at home: Panatta
219.article_body: Former Roland Garros winner Adriano Panatta said that Novak Djokovic should either get the COVID-19 vaccine or stay at home. This comes after Valentina Vezzali, Italy's cabinet undersecretary for sports, stated Djokovic could be allowed to play in the 2022 Rome Masters despite not being vaccinated. "Allowing his participation...causes more...confusion by giving the wrong message," Panatta added.

220.title: Rahane, Pujara, Ishant, Saha were told in advance: Chetan on dropping them
220.article_body: Team India's chief selector Chetan Sharma said the decision of dropping senior players like Cheteshwar Pujara, Ishant Sharma, Wriddhiman Saha, Ajinkya Rahane from the Test series against Sri Lanka was taken after "much deliberation". "We've spoken to them soon after the South Africa series, we told them...we'll not consider them for the two Test matches against Sri Lanka," he added.

221.title: My wife doesn't listen to me: Ashneer on wife wearing dress by designer he rejected
221.article_body: After Ashneer Grover's wife wore a dress designed by a 'Shark Tank' contestant he'd rejected, he addressed accusations of hypocrisy, saying, "Clearly my wife has a mind of her own and...doesn't listen to me." He said the designer left a dress for his wife Madhuri, adding, "I don't know what [she] liked, she wore it to 'The Kapil Sharma Show'."

222.title: UK ends mandatory self-isolation for COVID-19 +ve people
222.article_body: Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 in the UK will not be legally required to self-isolate from next week onwards, the government announced. The move comes as part of government's "Living with COVID" plan, which may also lead to reduced testing for coronavirus. The UK government has already scrapped vaccine passports and mask mandates for most venues, apart from hospitals.

223.title: Iranian lawmakers set 6 conditions to revive 2015 nuclear deal
223.article_body: In a letter to Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi, 250 Iranian lawmakers have laid out six conditions for the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal with global powers. One of the conditions is that the US and European parties should guarantee they wouldn't exit a restored agreement. Talks to revive the nuclear deal are being held in Vienna.

224.title: Was expected: Gavaskar on Pujara, Rahane being dropped for SL Tests
224.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said "it was expected" for batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane to be dropped from Team India's squad for the upcoming Test series against Sri Lanka. "If in the three Tests in South Africa, one of them had hit a century or played an innings of 80-90 runs...it would have been a different matter," Gavaskar stated.

225.title: James Faulkner should have been taken into 2-day custody: Salman Butt
225.article_body: Following James Faulkner's withdrawal from PSL 2022 over a payment dispute, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt opined that the Pakistan Cricket Board should have handled the matter legally. "Faulkner threw his helmet onto a chandelier...destroyed hotel property...also misbehaved with people over there. According to me, Faulkner should have been taken into two-day custody," Butt stated.

226.title: Great choice: Vaughan on Rohit's appointment as India's new Test captain
226.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan took to Twitter to talk about BCCI's decision of appointing Rohit Sharma as India's new Test captain, writing, "Great choice." The announcement was made on Saturday after chief selector Chetan Sharma named the 18-member squad for the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka, beginning March 4. Rohit has replaced Virat Kohli as the Test captain.

227.title: 4 Naxal supporters caught transporting explosives in Maharashtra
227.article_body: Four Naxal supporters have been apprehended in an anti-Naxal operation carried out in the Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra on Saturday. The group was reportedly caught transporting huge amounts of explosives from Telangana to Chhattisgarh. Police said Naxals were planning the extensive use of explosives in their forthcoming tactical counter-offensive campaign (TCOC), which they hold every year.

228.title: SP, Cong are soft on terror, address Osama as 'Ji': PM Modi in UP
228.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound UP's Hardoi, PM Narendra Modi alleged on Sunday that the Samajwadi Party (SP) and Congress are sympathetic towards terrorists and "address terrorists like Osama bin Laden as ‘Ji’". PM Modi further alleged that SP had withdrawn cases against several terrorists accused of carrying out attacks in UP. "SP...didn't allow trials against [terrorists]," he added.

229.title: Video of Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after ISL match goes viral; clarifies
229.article_body: A video of ATK Mohun Bagan defender Sandesh Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after their 2-2 draw against Kerala Blasters in ISL went viral. Jhingan issued a clarification, tweeting, "I told my teammate not to make excuses...so anyone taking my comment differently is only doing it to tarnish my name." He further wrote, "If...my comments have hurt anyone...my apologies."

230.title: Amazon, Reliance to compete for IPL telecast rights for a record ₹50,000 cr: Report
230.article_body: Amazon and Reliance Industries are expected to take on Sony Group and Walt Disney's India units for exclusive five-year TV and digital broadcast rights of IPL, Reuters reported on Sunday. The cost to acquire these rights could run to a record ₹50,000 crore, the report added. Disney-owned Star India paid ₹16,348 crore in 2017 to have these rights until 2022.

231.title: We've to bring India on right path: Maharashtra CM on anti-BJP front
231.article_body: After meeting Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to discuss an anti-BJP front, Maharashtra CM said, "We've to bring our country on the right path. Who [will be PM] can be discussed later." In an apparent criticism of BJP, he said, "Our Hindutva doesn't teach wrong politics. Some people only work for their agendas, even if the country goes to hell."

232.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies, make 4 changes
232.article_body: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Yuzvendra Chahal being replaced by Shreyas Iyer, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Avesh Khan and Shardul Thakur. Avesh is making his India debut.

233.title: BlackBerry 5G smartphone to no longer be made as startup behind it shuts down
233.article_body: OnwardMobility, the US-based company licensed to make new BlackBerry smartphones, has announced that it is shutting down. It confirmed that it will no longer be proceeding with the development of an ultra-secure BlackBerry 5G smartphone with a physical keyboard, which it had delayed earlier. "This was not a decision that we made lightly or in haste," OnwardMobility said.

234.title: Video shows rescue of 22 crew members after ship carrying luxury cars catches fire
234.article_body: The Portuguese Air Force released a video of how the 22 crew members onboard the ship carrying thousands of luxury cars were rescued after the vessel caught fire. The crew was lifted from Felicity Ace to an oil tanker before they were transported to Faial Island. Portugal's navy was quoted as saying that no one was hurt in the fire.

235.title: My Bat-Voice was atrocious, they told me to stop doing it: Robert
235.article_body: Actor Robert Pattinson, who will portray the titular superhero in upcoming film 'The Batman', has said that he tried to do something "radically different" with his Bat-Voice. "Everyone does this...gruff, gravelly thing, and I'm like, 'I'm going to...go really whispery'," the actor said. Robert added that it looked "absolutely atrocious" and was told to stop doing it after two weeks.

236.title: There'll be pressure on David when he plays for MI in IPL 2022: Watson
236.article_body: Talking about Tim David, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said there'll be pressure on the Singapore all-rounder when he plays for Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "It's not until you get into...game time when you really know how to absorb that pressure that's there," he added. The Singapore-born Australian was bought for ₹8.25 crore by MI in IPL 2022 mega auction.

237.title: Dalit groups hold protest in Bengaluru over Ambedkar photo row
237.article_body: Dalit groups held a massive protest march in Bengaluru on Saturday against a judge who objected to placing BR Ambedkar's portrait next to Mahatma Gandhi's on Republic Day in Raichur. The protestors demanded that the Karnataka district judge be suspended. The huge rally subsequently prompted Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to meet the protesters in Freedom Park and accept their memorandum.

238.title: People dumping garbage in public places to be fined ₹500 in Ghaziabad
238.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation will impose a ₹500 fine on people dumping garbage in public places, with about 200 staff having the power to penalise violators. The municipal authority plans to set up a plastic waste collection centre in each of the five zones of Ghaziabad by March. Ghaziabad generates about 1,200 metric tonnes of solid waste daily, a report said.

239.title: Mandaviya pays surprise visit to 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai
239.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya conducted a surprise inspection of a 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai on Sunday. These medical stores are locally known as 'Modi Ji ki shop', 'Modi Medical,' his official Twitter handle said. Mandaviya, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai from Saturday, will conclude his visit at All India Institute of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation.

240.title: Passenger found alive in burning ferry off Greece
240.article_body: A passenger was found alive on the stern of a still burning passenger ferry off Greece, the Greek coast guard said on Sunday. At least 281 out of 292 passengers and crew have been rescued from the ferry since the fire began on Friday. Eleven people are still missing, according to the coast guard and the ferry operator.

241.title: Russia & Belarus extend joint military drills amid Ukraine tensions
241.article_body: Belarus said on Sunday that joint military exercises with Russia have been extended amid rising tensions in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region. Russia had deployed an estimated 30,000 troops in Belarus, which borders Ukraine to the north, for the drills that were supposed to conclude today. On Saturday, multiple explosions were heard in Donbas' Donetsk, a city controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

242.title: BEST's Chalo app for bus tickets now available for iPhone users
242.article_body: The BEST's Chalo App for Mumbai bus commuters, which was launched for Android users last year, has now been launched on the iOS platform as well. "Chalo App for BEST bus tickets, bus passes, live tracking and passenger capacity is available for iPhone users," the bus service announced on Twitter. The app also notifies users of route changes and diversions.

243.title: Actor Cezanne Khan to marry girlfriend Afsheen later this year
243.article_body: Actor Cezanne Khan, who portrayed Anurag Basu in the original 'Kasautii Zindagi Kay', has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend Afsheen later this year. "Had it not been for the pandemic, we would have been married by now," he added. Cezanne further said he was single until he met Afsheen and they have been together for three years.

244.title: Digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter': Ethereum Co-Founder
244.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, the Co-Founder of the Ethereum blockchain, has said that the digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter'. "The winters are the time when a lot of those applications fall away and you can see which projects are actually long-term sustainable," said Buterin. Crypto winter refers to a prolonged bearish period where asset prices fall over many months.

245.title: Pilot shares video from cockpit as he manages to land plane amid Storm Eunice in UK
245.article_body: A pilot filmed the moment from inside the cockpit when he maneuvered a plane amid the strong winds of Storm Eunice in the United Kingdom. Qatar Airways captain Khalifa Al-Thani shared a video of how he managed to land a flight that was travelling from Doha to London. "Must have nerves of steel," commented a user on his video.

246.title: UK's Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19 at 95
246.article_body: The UK's 95-year-old monarch Queen Elizabeth II has tested positive for COVID-19 and is experiencing mild, cold-like symptoms, Buckingham Palace said on Sunday. The Queen, who has received three doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, will continue with light duties, the Palace said. Her eldest son Prince Charles and daughter-in-law Camilla had recently contracted COVID-19.

247.title: Farhan, Hrithik dance to 'Senorita' at Farhan's wedding; video surfaces
247.article_body: Actors Farhan Akhtar and Hrithik Roshan danced to the song 'Senorita' from their film 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara' at Farhan Akhtar and anchor Shibani Dandekar's wedding. Farhan and Hrithik were seen recreating the original song's dance steps during the wedding celebrations. Farhan and Shibani got married on February 19 among close family and friends in a farmhouse in Khandala.

248.title: Gujarat Titans become 1st IPL team to launch their logo on Metaverse
248.article_body: Gujarat Titans have become the first Indian Premier League (IPL) team to launch their logo on Metaverse. Gujarat Titans shared a video on Instagram after the launch, wherein the avatars of Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra and Shubman Gill could be seen unveiling the logo. "Our DNA is about reaching the top," Hardik's avatar said while explaining the logo.

249.title: What is 'pig-butchering' crypto scam where fraudsters use romance to lure people?
249.article_body: Fraudsters are using the Chinese-origin 'pig-butchering' technique, a reference to how a target is "fattened up" before being butchered, for cryptocurrency scams. They develop long-term romantic relationships with targets on dating apps and social media to make them interested in cryptocurrency, forex and gold investments. They introduce the target to a sham investment website or app they control.

250.title: BigBasket acquires Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech
250.article_body: BigBasket, a Tata enterprise, has acquired a Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech, which was announced by BigBasket CEO Hari Menon on Saturday. BigBasket will utilise Agrima Infotech's customer vision technology platform, Psyight, at the self-checkout counters of its retail stores. Psyight helps identify all Indian fruits and vegetables uniquely from an image without using barcodes.

251.title: India's 1st Biosafety mobile lab to probe outbreaks opens in Nashik
251.article_body: Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Bharati Pravin Pawar on Friday inaugurated India's first Biosafety Level-3 mobile laboratory in Nashik. Reportedly, the lab will probe newly emerging and highly-infectious viral infections. Pawar added it will help in real-time data collection to facilitate quick containment of outbreaks. The lab is built at a cost of about ₹25 crore.

252.title: Ukraine will not respond to Russian provocations: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy
252.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that his country would not respond to provocations amid threats of Russian invasion. He added that the reports that Ukraine has been shelling regions controlled by Moscow-backed separatists and inside the Russian border are "pure lies". Zelenskyy was addressing senior Western security officials at the annual Munich Security Conference.

253.title: Pakistan reports 1,644 new COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths
253.article_body: Pakistan reported 1,644 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, said National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC) on Sunday. The authorities added the infection rate decreased to 3.29% from 4.15% in the same period. The number of patients in critical care stood at 1,386. Meanwhile, the overall death toll reached 30,009 in the country.

254.title: Hardik to be considered for selection only when 100% fit: Chetan Sharma
254.article_body: Providing an update on Hardik Pandya's return to Team India squad, BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said the India all-rounder will be immediately considered for selection only when he is 100% match fit. Notably, Hardik isn't a part of Indian Test and T20I squads for upcoming series against Sri Lanka. Currently, the 28-year-old is recovering from recurring back injury issues.

255.title: Countries aim to study dangers of chemical waste: UN draft resolution
255.article_body: A draft resolution of UN Environment Assembly said a proposal led by Switzerland could form a new intergovernmental panel to study dangers of chemical waste, pollution. The proposal would aim to create a strong "Science-Policy panel" similar to UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. Last week, a UN expert warned chemical waste has been killing more people worldwide than COVID-19.

256.title: BMC planning ₹1,600 cr link road connecting Dahisar & Bhayander
256.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning a 5-kilometre-long link road connecting Dahisar and Bhayander, construction of which will cost around ₹1,600 crore. BMC's Additional Commissioner P Velrasu said nearly 2-kilometre of it will pass through salt commissioner’s land and the process of acquiring land will start soon. The land acquisition is also expected to cost another ₹1,600 crore.

257.title: Users lose NFTs worth $1.7 million in OpenSea 'phishing attack': CEO
257.article_body: OpenSea Co-Founder and CEO Devin Finzer confirmed that 32 users lost their NFTs worth $1.7 million in a 'phishing attack'. "Importantly, rumours that this was a $200 million hack are false. The attack doesn't appear to be active at this point, we haven't seen any malicious activity from the attacker's account in 2 hours," Finzer said in a tweet.

258.title: Teacher dies, 3 students injured after falling from Ferris wheel in Haryana's Ambala
258.article_body: A 23-year-old school teacher, Riya Garg, died while three students aged between 11 and 12 were injured after falling from a Ferris wheel at an amusement park in Haryana's Ambala. Garg fell from 20 feet and died on spot when the grill of one of seating boxes of the wheel broke. Autopsy revealed Garg received head injuries and internal wounds.

259.title: T'gana CM meets Maha CM to discuss anti-BJP front, says 'good result soon'
259.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday met Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray along with other TRS leaders in Mumbai to discuss the formation of a third national political front to oppose the BJP. The meeting was attended by Shiv Sena spokesperson Sanjay Raut and actor-politician Prakash Raj. "You'll...see a good result of our meeting very soon," said KCR.

260.title: Very excited: Sanjay Kapoor on daughter's acting debut with Johar's film
260.article_body: Sanjay Kapoor has said he is extremely excited for his daughter Shanaya Kapoor's acting debut. "She has chosen this line, it's a fantastic line, we all love it, our whole family is in (it), but she would have chosen anything (else), I would've been as excited," he added. Shanaya announced her debut film with Karan Johar's Dharma Productions in 2021.

261.title: Pune civic body's polio immunisation drive to begin on February 27
261.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) polio immunisation drive is set to commence on February 27. At least 3 lakh children are expected to be vaccinated under this initiative, for which 1,350 booths have been set up. "We...have 70 transit teams of two people each to vaccinate...children who might be travelling on [that day]," PMC immunisation officer Dr Suryakant Deokar said.

262.title: India asks its nationals whose stay isn't essential & students to leave Ukraine temporarily
262.article_body: The Embassy of India in Kyiv has issued an advisory for Indian nationals in Ukraine amid threats of Russian invasion. The advisory read, "In view of the continued high levels of tensions and uncertainties with respect to the situation in Ukraine, all Indian nationals whose stay is not deemed essential and all Indian students, are advised to leave Ukraine temporarily."

263.title: Suspected LeT terrorist arrested in J&K’s Doda; arms recovered
263.article_body: A suspected terrorist belonging to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) was arrested by a joint search party of police, Rashtriya Rifles and Sashastra Seema Bal in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district on Sunday. A pistol, two magazines and nine rounds were recovered from the man, who has been identified as Adil Iqbal Butt, a resident of Sazan-Bajarni village, said officials.

264.title: Dance teacher loses job to Covid, Delhi Police helps him find work
264.article_body: Delhi Police helped a dance teacher, Sawalkar, who had lost his job due to the COVID-19 pandemic, get job at a restaurant. Sawalkar reportedly started living in night shelter after coming from Mumbai after losing his job. "I have joined Sandoz...in food packaging department...I will get Rs 18,000 salary per month...My aim is to continue as dance teacher," he said.

265.title: Pujara smashes 91(83) in Ranji Trophy a day after being dropped from India Test squad
265.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 91 runs off 83 deliveries in the second innings of his team Saurashtra's Ranji Trophy match against Mumbai in Ahmedabad, a day after being dropped from Team India Test squad. The 34-year-old right-handed batter, who was dismissed for a four-ball duck in the first innings, slammed 16 fours and a six in the second innings.

266.title: Saha reveals chat with Dravid over Test axe, says head coach told him to not be shocked
266.article_body: Wriddhiman Saha revealed that after India's Test series against South Africa, Rahul Dravid called him to his room and informed him team management has been "wanting to look at a new face as wicketkeeper". "[Dravid said] 'Don't be shocked if you aren't selected for Sri Lanka Tests....[Meanwhile] if you want to take some other decision...you can do that'," added Saha.

267.title: We're doing our job: Siddhant on Ranveer's permission for Gehraiyaan
267.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, speaking about comments of trolls asking if he sought Ranveer Singh's permission to do 'Gehraiyaan', said, "We are just doing our job." The film features intimate scenes of the actor with Ranveer's wife actress Deepika Padukone. "In fact, when I signed the film, [Ranveer] was the first person I called and he was really happy," Siddhant added.

268.title: Farhan, Shibani to host wedding reception later in February: Reports
268.article_body: Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar will be hosting their wedding reception in Mumbai later this month, according to reports. The couple tied the knot on February 19 in the presence of their family members and close friends at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's Khandala farmhouse. The wedding was attended by Farah Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Rhea Chakraborty, Shankar Mahadevan and others.

269.title: Bowler once gave away 77 runs in just one over
269.article_body: Wellington's Bert Vance conceded 77 runs in an over in a first-class match against Canterbury on February 20, 1990. Canterbury needed 95 to win in two overs and to encourage them to go after the target and lose wickets, Vance bowled a 22-ball over, including 17 no-balls. Interestingly, only five legitimate deliveries were bowled as umpires lost track of proceedings.

270.title: Aardvark born for the first time in 90 years in UK zoo, video released
270.article_body: A zoo in the United Kingdom has witnessed the first aardvark birth in its 90-year history and has named the animal 'Dobby' after a Harry Potter character that it resembles. A video of the female aardvark born in January 2022 was also shared by the Chester Zoo. The sex of the calf was revealed recently.

271.title: 18 Uttar Pradesh police officers booked in fake encounter case after 17 yrs
271.article_body: A case has been registered against 18 police personnel, including the then Superintendent of Police (SP), in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur in connection with an alleged fake encounter that took place 17 years ago. In October 2004, two men were allegedly shot dead by police on allegations of them being members of gangster Saragana Naresha Dhimar's gang.

272.title: Money was being given at poll booths, our duty to check: Sonu after car impounded
272.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, who was stopped on Sunday from visiting polling booths in Punjab's Moga, claimed he received information that "threat calls" were being made at various polling booths by opposition parties, especially Shiromani Akali Dal. "Money is being distributed at some booths," he added. Sonu said that he had gone out to "check" the situation and "ensure fair elections".

273.title: 9-year-old Indian boy becomes world's youngest certified yoga instructor
273.article_body: A nine-year-old Indian boy has become the world’s youngest certified yoga instructor and created a Guinness World Record. Reyansh Surani, who resides in Dubai, said that he began practising yoga with his parents at the age of four. Reyansh completed his 200 Hour Yoga Teacher's Training Course and received certification from the Anand Shekhar Yoga School last year.

274.title: Do not create issues: Chetan Sharma to journalist over remark on Hardik Pandya
274.article_body: After a journalist remarked that Hardik Pandya will get fit before the first match of IPL and will get selected for Team India on the basis of IPL, chief selector Chetan Sharma said, "You are not a member of selection committee." Chetan added, "You won't decide who will get selected." "Do not create issues," Chetan further said.

275.title: Rahat Fateh Ali Khan tests COVID-19 +ve, cancels Dubai show
275.article_body: Pakistani singer Rahat Fateh Ali Khan's team on Saturday announced that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and cancelled his show in Dubai. The Mystical Sufi Night event has been rescheduled for March 12 as the singer will be quarantining in Dubai for the next 10 days. As per reports, the singer had tested negative for COVID-19 before leaving Pakistan.

276.title: For us he has already become Punjab CM: Bhagwant Mann's mother
276.article_body: AAP CM candidate for poll-bound Punjab, Bhagwant Mann’s mother Harpal Kaur on Sunday said that for her Mann has already become the CM. She stated, "For us, he has already become the CM. People love him." Reacting to his mother’s statement, Mann said, "If a mother has said this, what else does one want…Youth, students everyone wants a change."

277.title: Ruturaj, Sarfaraz deserve a place in Test squad vs SL: Vengsarkar
277.article_body: Ex-India captain Dilip Vengsarkar said that Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sarfaraz Khan "deserve a place" in Team India's squad for the upcoming Test series against Sri Lanka. "Looking at the team, a couple of players...haven't done much to merit their place in the squad," he stated. "Selectors are damaging [Ruturaj and Sarfaraz's] morale by not selecting them for India," he added.

278.title: Head Constable from Noida loses ₹2 lakh in online fraud
278.article_body: A Head Constable from Noida lost ₹2 lakh in online fraud. The incident took place after Devesh Kumar Upadhyay lost his debit card and was asked to download an app by a person claiming to be a bank official to block it. "As I downloaded the app, the suspect got...access to my phone and fraudulently withdrew ₹2 lakh," Upadhyay said.

279.title: Finally my community has a film: Rajkummar's sister-in-law on Badhaai Do
279.article_body: Rajkummar Rao's sister-in-law Parnalekha has penned a note praising his recently released film 'Badhaai Do'. "'Badhaai Do' is an intimate revolution that will activate a desire [for] transformation in the way 'LGBTQIA+' oriented films are made in India," she wrote, adding, "Finally, my community has a film, wherein, two girls are not sexually objectified for being two dykes in love."

280.title: PMC holds weekly demolition drives to curb illegal constructions
280.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has intensified checks on illegal constructions with weekly demolition drives in city. Illegal constructions have increased around areas of Shivane and Bavdhan, among others, officials said. "In the last month alone, several notices have been issued...We're ensuring that every week...action is taken and buildings that are found illegal are razed,” an official said.

281.title: Man held for molesting 10-yr-old kills self at Raj police station
281.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who was arrested on charges of molesting a 10-year-old girl, allegedly killed himself in a police station lock-up in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Sunday, police said. The man had three previous cases under POCSO Act registered against him in different police stations, a senior police official said. A magisterial inquiry is being done, the senior police official added.

282.title: Simplicity was the key ingredient: Hrithik's mom on Farhan-Shibani's wedding
282.article_body: Hrithik Roshan's mother Pinkie Roshan has described Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar's wedding ceremony as 'surreal'. She shared a picture of herself in the outfit she wore at their wedding and wrote, "It was too special, total bliss to have witnessed a marriage ceremony that was surreal, simplicity was the key ingredient." "God bless Farhan and Shibani," Pinkie added.

283.title: What's 'Goli maaro' if not incitement to kill: Ex-SC judge on hate speech
283.article_body: Former Supreme Court judge Justice Madan Lokur, on Sunday, while delivering an address on hate speech in India said, "We have had, in Delhi, a minister...saying 'Goli Maaro'. What is that if not incitement to kill. But he might say 'I never said it, I just said you shoot. I didn't say whom to shoot...the listeners said traitors'."

284.title: ₹295 cr mansion in UK to be sold in real life & metaverse in world's 1st such sale
284.article_body: A £29 million (around ₹295 crore) mansion in the UK will be developed and sold both in reality and in the metaverse in the world's first such deal, according to property developer Stately Homes. The mansion will be sold with an NFT containing the copyrighted blueprint and virtual version. The mansion will have 70 rooms in total, including 11 bedrooms.

285.title: Russia reports over 1.7 lakh new COVID-19 cases, 745 deaths
285.article_body: Russia reported 1,70,699 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the authorities said on Sunday. The country also recorded 745 deaths in the same period taking the total fatality count to 3,45,500 since the pandemic began. Saint Petersburg saw 16,599 new cases, the highest in the country, while in Moscow, 6,388 cases were registered.

286.title: 13 years passed, all this is still so fresh in my mind: Abhishek on 'Delhi 6'
286.article_body: As the movie 'Delhi 6' clocked 13 years on Sunday, actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post. "From Mamdu's Jalebi, to Dadi's laad-pyaar to Bittu's chirping and Ali Chacha's words of wisdom...13 years passed, but all this is still so fresh in my mind. #13yearsofDelhi6," Abhishek wrote. 'Delhi 6' also featured actresses Sonam Kapoor and Waheeda Rehman.

287.title: I am MP from UP but previous govt didn’t let me work: PM Modi
287.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that despite being a member of parliament from Uttar Pradesh, he wasn't allowed to work for people in the state by the previous government. "I am sad that from 2014 to 2017 these 'parivarvadis' did not support me," said Modi addressing a rally in Hardoi. "Should such people be re-elected?" he asked.

288.title: Samson is in our scheme of things for T20 WC: BCCI chief selector Chetan
288.article_body: BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson, who has represented India in 10 T20Is so far, is definitely in the board's scheme of things for T20 World Cup 2022. The 27-year-old has been included in India's 18-member squad for upcoming three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. Samson last played in a T20I against Sri Lanka in July 2021.

289.title: Kamathipura residents protest against 'Gangubai...' over 'shameful' portrayal of area
289.article_body: The residents of Kamathipura staged a protest and raised slogans against upcoming film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for allegedly showcasing the area in a bad light. The locals alleged that the way the area has been portrayed in film is "wrong" and shameful". The film is based on Gangubai Kothewali, who was considered to be the matriarch of Mumbai's Kamathipura in 1960s.

290.title: I don't use social media: Nilekani as he lists 3 devices he uses for work
290.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani in an interview revealed that he doesn't use social media. Speaking about the three modes he works with, he said, "In the create mode to work...I use a laptop...For the curate mode...or just browse, I use an iPad; and for...communication I use...phone." He added that he uses Twitter to broadcast information and not for discussions.

291.title: Wordle is now using ad-trackers: Report
291.article_body: New York Time's Wordle is now using ad-trackers, according to a report by Gizmodo. The report states that some of the trackers are from NYT, but others are being used to send data to third parties, including Google. "NYT didn't change the game, but they sure changed the deployment. Lots more tracking," said Ben Adida, Executive Director of VotingWorks.

292.title: Russia's treatment of Ukraine similar to Soviet threats: Finland Prez
292.article_body: Finland President Sauli Niinistö said on Saturday that Russia's treatment of Ukraine reminded him of Soviet leader Josef Stalin's attempt to invade Finland in 1939 during World War II. "Stalin thought...he will split [Finland]...The opposite happened. People [were] united...we see the same in Ukraine," he said. His comments come amid build-up of some 1.9 lakh Russian troops on Ukrainian border.

293.title: Half of India's population under 25, suitable for Olympic Movement: Nita Ambani
293.article_body: Businesswoman and International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Nita Ambani said, "Nearly half of India's population, over 600 million people, are under 25 years of age." She added, "This makes India one of the most crucial and exciting places to nurture and grow the Olympic Movement." India will host the IOC Session in 2023 after 40 years.

294.title: Completely false: Tom Holland on buying house in London with Zendaya
294.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has said that the reports of him buying a house in London with girlfriend Zendaya are completely false. "I've had so many people call me...I didn't buy a house!" Tom added. He further said that he doesn't know how the rumours started, adding, "I was like, 'Wow! What a surprise! I wonder when I'll get the keys'."

295.title: Lineman electrocuted in Ghaziabad, ₹11 lakh ex-gratia announced
295.article_body: A lineman in Ghaziabad was killed after being electrocuted while repairing a fault in an 11,000-kilowatt power cable. The victim's family members had blocked traffic on Eastern Peripheral Expressway, demanding strict action against those responsible for switching on the line. The blockade was lifted after police assured strict action and an ex-gratia of ₹11 lakh was announced for victim's family.

296.title: 2 labourers killed, 2 grievously injured as steam boiler explodes in TN
296.article_body: Two labourers from Jharkhand were killed after a steam boiler at a prawn farm in Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai district exploded on Sunday, police said. Two other workers from Thirumullaivasal village, who sustained grievous injuries in the incident, have been admitted to a government hospital in Sirkazhi. Exact details about the incident will be known only after preliminary inquiry, police added.

297.title: Man held for posing as Colonel, cheating with Army job offers in Ahmednagar
297.article_body: In a joint operation with the MI unit of the Pune headquartered Southern Command, the Ahmednagar district police arrested a 24-year-old man posing as a Colonel in the Indian Army. The man allegedly cheated several people on the pretext of giving them jobs in the Army. An Army uniform, multiple fake Army insignia and several fake documents were seized.

298.title: I fell down iron stairs, all I could think of was Bob Saget: Dana Delany
298.article_body: American actress Dana Delany said that she recently fell down some iron stairs. "I fell down some iron stairs headfirst (totally sober!)...all I could think of was poor Bob Saget," she said. "So I grabbed the handrail with my face...I was afraid it was fractured but thankfully, no. Folks at St John's emergency took great care of me," Dana added.

299.title: Gehraiyaan role hard for family, they've seen it up close: Deepika
299.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has stated that it was difficult for her family to digest what her character in 'Gehraiyaan' goes through. "They've seen it so up close and personal with me that I think at a personal level it was difficult for them to go through that," she added. Deepika further said they appreciated the way mental health was depicted.

300.title: ICJ to resume hearing on Rohingya genocide in Myanmar
300.article_body: The International Court of Justice will resume hearing the case of Rohingya genocide in Myanmar on Monday. African country Gambia, which claims to represent an organisation of Muslim nations, has accused Myanmar of breach of the genocide convention. As many as seven lakh Rohingya Muslims reportedly fled the country after a military crackdown against them in 2017.

301.title: WB minister Sadhan Pande passes away aged 71; CM Mamata expresses grief
301.article_body: West Bengal Cabinet Minister and senior TMC leader Sadhan Pande passed away on Sunday morning in Mumbai at the age of 71. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee offered condolences on the demise of the TMC leader. "Had a wonderful relation for long. Deeply pained at this loss. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends, followers," the CM said in a tweet.

302.title: Brie Larson wraps up 'Captain Marvel 2', shares pic from sets
302.article_body: American actress Brie Larson has completed shooting for 'The Marvels', the sequel to the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She took to social media to share a picture of a chair which has her character's name written on it. "See you in a year, Carol," Brie captioned the picture. The film is slated to release on February 17, 2023.

303.title: Tripura govt bans political events, rallies on school grounds
303.article_body: Tripura government on Saturday issued an order banning political parties from using school resources, including playgrounds, for holding political events or rallies. The order mentioned that some headmasters had given permission for political gatherings during school hours and called it "unacceptable". It said that such gatherings pose a "serious threat to teaching-learning activities".

304.title: No surprise there: Gavaskar on Rohit being named India Test captain
304.article_body: After Rohit Sharma was appointed as India Test captain, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said he wasn't surprised by the decision as Rohit is certain to play in all three formats. The 34-year-old opener was appointed as Test captain ahead of the T20I and Test series against Sri Lanka at home. Notably, Rohit is India's all-format captain now.

305.title: US’ California proposes bill to allow citizens to sue gun-makers
305.article_body: The Governor of the US' California, Gavin Newsom, has proposed a bill that seeks to allow private citizens to sue the gun manufacturers for selling assault weapons. Notably, manufacturing and selling assault weapons was banned in the state for decades but that law was overturned last year by a district judge, who declared it unconstitutional.

306.title: I was fired from projects after announcing first pregnancy: Neha Dhupia
306.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said that she was fired from projects after announcing her first pregnancy. "During Mehr's time, I had to create work...I was being myself because being pregnant wasn't a problem...But the industry changes. Before I announced my pregnancy, I was a part of a few projects. Did I get fired from those projects? Yes, I did," Dhupia said.

307.title: Donald Glover, 'Atlanta' writers racially harassed in London: Writers
307.article_body: The writers of comedy-drama series 'Atlanta' have revealed they along with actor Donald Glover were racially harassed in London. They added that a group of people said, "You guys are black, you've gone to jail and do things like that." They claimed we could break into a bar because we carry hammers, which is slang for guns, the writers said.

308.title: LaBeouf got mad, Brad got in middle of 'volatile moment': Scott on 'Fury'
308.article_body: Actor Scott Eastwood said that he had "volatile encounter" with actor Shia LaBeouf during film 'Fury' and that Brad Pitt had to intervene to resolve situation. "[LaBeouf] got mad at me...it turned into a volatile moment...Brad Pitt ultimately got in the middle of." LaBeouf had reportedly confronted Eastwood over a miscommunication about filming.

309.title: Voting underway at pink polling booth managed by women in Punjab's Moga
309.article_body: Voting is underway for Assembly polls at pink booth in Moga, Punjab, which provides special arrangements for pregnant women and persons with disabilities, among other people. These booths were set up by the Election Commission across the state to encourage women voters to vote. Pink booths are managed entirely by women polling personnel.

310.title: Ethiopia starts generating electricity from dam on Nile river
310.article_body: Ethiopian government officials said on Sunday that a hydroelectric dam built on a tributary of the Nile river has started generating electricity. The Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam is expected to produce over 5,000 megawatts of power and will be the largest hydroelectric project in Africa. "From now on, there will be nothing that will stop Ethiopia," PM Abiy Ahmed said.

311.title: Kangana says '₹200 cr will be burnt to ashes' ahead of 'Gangubai...' release
311.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has seemingly taken a dig at Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', which is scheduled to release in theatres on February 25. She took to her Instagram Stories and said "₹200 crore will be burnt to ashes" this Friday "for a papa (movie mafia daddy) ki pari because papa wants to prove that romcom bimbo can act".

312.title: China plans to turn Olympic ski jump into a very large water slide
312.article_body: China plans to turn the Shougang Big Air ski jump structure, built on the site of a decommissioned steel mill for the Winter Olympics, into a very large water slide during the summers. Alternatively, it could be used for grass sledding after covering it with turf. Some of the venues from the 2008 Summer Game were earlier re-purposed by Beijing.

313.title: Body of man accused in POCSO case and absconding for 3 yrs found in Maha well
313.article_body: A person's body, which was found in a well in Maharashtra, has been identified as a man, who was an accused in a POCSO case and was absconding from Kerala for last three years. Investigations revealed he was murdered by two Kashid-based persons over a fight and his body was tied to a cement pole and immersed in the well.

314.title: He didn't tell me he was married, had daughters when we met: Aruna on husband
314.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani said she did not know her husband Kuku Kohli was already married and had kids when she first met him. "He didn't tell me he was married...it didn't look good to speak about our relationship as he was married...with a wife and daughters...I am talking about it because his first wife passed away...few months back," she said.

315.title: Pune passenger trains ticket fare increased by about 50%: Report
315.article_body: An official has said that Pune Railway Division has increased passenger trains ticket fare as per an order from higher authorities, which mentioned that the fare should be the same as express trains, Hindustan Times reported. The passenger trains ticket fare has been increased by about 50%, report said. A passenger claimed that the facilities provided are the same.

316.title: Sonu Sood stopped from visiting polling booths in Punjab; his car impounded
316.article_body: The Election Commission on Sunday stopped actor Sonu Sood from visiting the polling booths in Punjab's Moga, from where his sister Malvika Sood Sachar is contesting in the Assembly elections on a Congress ticket. Sonu has been allegedly accused of trying to influence the voters. Earlier, Sonu's SUV was impounded on the basis of "suspicious activity", according to police.

317.title: Video shows helicopter crashing into ocean at crowded Miami beach; 2 injured
317.article_body: A helicopter crashed into the ocean at Miami’s South Beach on Saturday afternoon, leaving two injured. A video of the incident shared by the Miami Beach Police captured the moment when the helicopter crashed near an area that was full of swimmers. The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has launched an investigation into the incident.

318.title: Russia planning biggest war in Europe since 1945: UK PM Boris Johnson amid Ukraine crisis
318.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has said Russia is planning for something that could be the biggest war in Europe since 1945. He said, "You're looking at not just an invasion through the east...but according to the intelligence we're seeing, coming down from the north...and actually encircling Kyiv itself, as Joe Biden explained to a lot of us last night."

319.title: Not a Tinder swindler, wanted to meet girls: Hayut in 1st interview after Netflix show
319.article_body: Shimon Hayut, who went by the alias Simon Leviev has given his first interview after the Netflix documentary 'The Tinder Swindler' streamed. In a clip from the interview, Hayut said, "I was just a single guy who wanted to meet some girls on Tinder...I'm not a Tinder swindler."  The documentary covers stories of women who were allegedly defrauded by Hayut.

320.title: FIR against Sameer Wankhede for misrepresenting age to get bar licence
320.article_body: An FIR has been registered against former Mumbai NCB zonal director Sameer Wankhede for allegedly obtaining a bar licence by willful misrepresentation of his age, police said. The FIR was filed on Saturday night based on the complaint of State Excise department's Shankar Gogavale, who alleged that Wankhede was below 18 years of age in 1996-97 while obtaining the licence.

321.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha claims EVM glitches at several booths in Punjab
321.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday alleged EVM glitches at several booths across Punjab. He accused SAD and Congress of booth capturing. "In Bhoa AC's Booth No 95, a polling agent of Congress has placed his chair next to EVM so that he has a clear view of who is voting for which party," Chadha tweeted.

322.title: Vikrant Massey, Sheetal Thakur share pics from their haldi ceremony
322.article_body: Actors Vikrant Massey and Sheetal Thakur took to their respective Instagram accounts to share pictures from their haldi ceremony. Reacting to Massey's post, actress Neha Laxmi wrote, "Congratulations @vikrantmassey you two look like such a happy couple!!" Vikrant and Sheetal got married on Friday after seven years of dating.

323.title: My mom called Marvel producers, said 'give my son toilet breaks': Tom Holland
323.article_body: Actor Tom Holland said his mom called Marvel producers to ask them to give him "toilet breaks". Tom said, "I was in suit for...11 hours...I was young...wanted to impress studio...didn't want them to think I needed breaks...two days later producer came...was like, 'How are your kidneys?'...My mom called...biggest studio in world and was like, 'Give my son more toilet breaks!'"

324.title: Bengaluru police bust illegal dance bar in Koramangala; 3 arrested
324.article_body: Three people were arrested after Bengaluru police busted an illegal dance bar in Koramangala, where purportedly 28 women from multiple states had been brought to perform. A senior police officer said that the women were allegedly brought there under the pretext of bartender jobs and were forced to perform. Lakhs of rupees were reportedly seized from 21 customers present there.

325.title: 24-yr-old Hyd woman set on fire by labourer for resisting advances
325.article_body: A 24-year-old Hyderabad-based woman died on Saturday after reportedly being set on fire by a labourer for resisting his advances. Reports said that the man set her ablaze at an isolated place in Telangana's Narayanpet. The victim's father had reportedly complained to police about her being missing a few days ago. Police said that the victim's family suspected the labourer.

326.title: Even Rahul Dravid suggested I think about retirement: Wriddhiman Saha after Test axe
326.article_body: After being dropped from India Test squad, Wriddhiman Saha revealed that the team management had earlier told him that he would not be considered henceforth. He added, "I could not tell this so long as I was part of the India team setup...Even head coach Rahul Dravid suggested that I think about taking retirement."

327.title: Ranbir, Arjun Kapoor reach Agra to attend filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding
327.article_body: Several celebrities, including Ranbir Kapoor, Arjun Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor and Bhushan Kumar, have reached Agra to attend filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding, as per reports. Actor Varun Sharma was also seen arriving in Agra. The filmmaker, known for films like 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety', will reportedly tie the knot with long-time girlfriend Alisha Vaid today.

328.title: He's different from characters he plays on screen: Ananya on Deverakonda
328.article_body: Ananya Panday, speaking about her 'Liger' co-star Vijay Deverakonda, said that he is different from the characters he plays on screen. She added that he's "very shy, quiet, very sweet and enduring" and an amazing co-star. Speaking about 'Liger', Ananya said that it's a "super popcorn entertaining masala" film, adding, "I couldn't have asked for anything bigger."

329.title: SAD-BSP to make clean sweep in Punjab, we'll get 80+ seats: Sukhbir Badal
329.article_body: As the Assembly polls in Punjab are underway, Sukhbir Singh Badal, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief said that the Shiromani Akali Dal-BSP alliance is going to make a "clean sweep". "We will get 80 plus seats," Badal added. Badal along with SAD leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal and SAD patron Parkash Singh Badal arrived at the polling station in Lambi today.

330.title: Epstein-linked model agent found dead in French jail: Prosecutors
330.article_body: Late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's close associate and model agent Jean-Luc Brunel was found dead in his cell at a prison in France's Paris, prosecutors said on Saturday. Brunel was awaiting his trial on charges of raping a minor and sexual harassment. Epstein allegedly died by suicide at a prison in US' New York in 2019.

331.title: Grenade attack injures 3 policemen in Pakistan’s Peshawar
331.article_body: At least three policemen were injured in a grenade attack in Pakistan's Peshawar. The incident, which was reportedly captured on CCTV cameras, showed a man lobbing two grenades at a police station in the city. The attacker managed to escape after the act, according to media reports. The injured policemen were taken to Lady Reading Hospital for treatment.

332.title: Maid urged to sell her kidney, cheated of ₹8 lakh; Delhi man held
332.article_body: Delhi man, Arvind Kumar, was arrested after his friend Rabina Badi, from Nepal, allegedly cheated maid Kalpana Magar of ₹8 lakh. Badi told Magar she had relocated to Delhi after selling kidney for ₹4 crore and that it was possible to lead normal life with one kidney. Badi added Magar would have to pay "few lakhs" before kidney was harvested.

333.title: Russia planning full-scale attack on Ukraine: NATO chief
333.article_body: Denying claims of military pull-out by Russia, NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg has said that the country is planning a full-scale attack on Ukraine. "No troops are being withdrawn as Russia says, but new troops are being added," he said, adding that Russia was preparing a pretext for the attack. "We want to get Russia to change course," he further said.

334.title: US' FDA issues warning after 1,100 dead rodents found at retailer facility
334.article_body: US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued a warning over the potentially contaminated food at variety store chain Family Dollar in six states after 1,100 dead rodents were found at the retailer's distribution facility in Arkansas. The warning was issued for Alabama, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri and Tennessee. FDA had investigated the facility in January following a complaint.

335.title: Just chamchagiri: Virender Sehwag on journalist's threatening WhatsApp texts to Saha
335.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of WhatsApp messages sent to him by a journalist forcing him to give an interview after being dropped from Team India, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Extremely sad." He added, "Such sense of entitlement, neither is he respected nor a journalist...just chamchagiri." "This is where the journalism has gone," Saha had tweeted while sharing the screenshot.

336.title: Delhi Police officer's daughter strangled to death by her friend's husband
336.article_body: A Delhi Police officer's daughter in her 20s was allegedly strangled to death by her friend's husband. Investigators said her body was found at the home of the suspect, who is absconding. The victim's mother claimed he called the woman to his house as he needed her help to buy a saree for his wife as a Valentine's Day gift.

337.title: Newly-wed bride cast vote in UP before leaving for her in-laws’ house
337.article_body: A newly-wed bride, Julie, cast her vote at a polling booth in UP’s Firozabad Assembly constituency on Sunday, before leaving for her in-laws’ house. Julie, who got married last night, arrived at the location in her wedding dress today. Voting for the third phase of UP Assembly polls, in 59 seats, began at 7 am today.

338.title: SRK told me 'you're very good, things will happen': Actor Satyajeet Dubey
338.article_body: Actor Satyajeet Dubey said actor Shah Rukh Khan told him to keep trying and things will happen for him. "My first film was produced by Shah Rukh..it didn't work...I was like a baby...kept wondering where I stood...I met SRK after 2-3 years. He told me, 'You are very good. Just keep trying like you've been doing...things will happen'." Dubey said.

339.title: If people think Sonu is star, it's icing on cake for me: Malvika on polls
339.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood's sister Malvika Sood, who is contesting from Punjab's Moga seat on Congress ticket, said that she feels positive about the poll day. "People are calling up...from foreign countries...are cheering for my support...Many of them have assured to vote for me...If people think Sonu Sood is a star, it's an icing on the cake for me," she said.

340.title: Hugh Grant joins cast of 'Wonka', to play Oompa Loompa in the film: Reports
340.article_body: Actor Hugh Grant has reportedly signed on to play an Oompa Loompa in the upcoming 'Charlie And The Chocolate Factory' prequel film, 'Wonka'. According to reports, he has also started shooting for the project at the University of Oxford's Hertford College. The upcoming film will feature Timothée Chalamet as young Willy Wonka. 'Wonka' also stars Olivia Colman and Sally Hawkins.

341.title: Actress Lindsey Pearlman found dead days after going missing in Los Angeles
341.article_body: Actress Lindsey Pearlman, who starred in shows like 'General Hospital' and 'American Housewife', was found dead on Friday, days after going missing in Los Angeles. Investigators had sought the public's help in finding the 43-year-old actress who was last seen around noon last Sunday. The cause of death and the circumstances of her disappearance are under investigation.

342.title: Wife making frequent discreet calls to another man at odd hours is cruelty: Kerala HC
342.article_body: While granting a decree of divorce to a couple, Kerala High Court ruled, "Making discreet phone calls frequently by the wife with another man disregarding the warning of the husband, that too at odd hours, amounts to matrimonial cruelty." The court, however, noted that the evidence of phone calls is not enough to infer adultery on part of the wife.

343.title: BJP’s slip issued upon voting for SP, discrepancies in VVPAT: SP
343.article_body: As the third phase of UP Assembly polls began on Sunday, the Samajwadi Party (SP) alleged discrepancies in the Electronic Voting Machine (EVM). The party alleged that the VVPAT issued a slip of the BJP on pressing the button for the SP at a polling booth in Kanpur rural. The party further stated about the "defective" VVPAT in Hamirpur District.

344.title: Over 1,500 ceasefire violations reported in Ukraine: Europe agency
344.article_body: Over 1,500 ceasefire violations were reported in east Ukraine on Saturday, believed to be the highest this year, according to the world's largest regional security body Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE). Of the total ceasefire violations, 1,413 were explosions, the OSCE said. Earlier, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said that Russia is "poised to strike" Ukraine.

345.title: FIR lodged against Kanpur Mayor for sharing photo of voting on WhatsApp
345.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against Kanpur Mayor Pramila Pandey for the breach of secrecy of voting at the Hudson school polling station, according to Kanpur Nagar DM. Pandey had allegedly shared on WhatsApp a photo of the Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) as she cast her vote during the third phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls.

346.title: We lost 1 generation to terrorism, 2nd to drugs; vote carefully: Sidhu
346.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu said people will vote in large numbers to bring the change. "On one side is the mafia system of Badal family and Captain Amarinder Singh. On the other side are those who love Punjab," Sidhu added. "We lost one generation to terrorism, the second to drugs, so, today we've to vote carefully," Sidhu stated.

347.title: China aiming laser at our aircraft an act of intimidation: Australian PM
347.article_body: Days after a Chinese navy vessel reportedly aimed a laser at an Australian military surveillance aircraft, Prime Minister Scott Morrison criticised it calling it "an act of intimidation". "I can see it no other way than an act of intimidation…unprovoked, unwarranted," said Morrison. "Australia will never accept such acts of intimidation," he added.

348.title: 2 injured as helicopter crashes near crowded US beach; video surfaces
348.article_body: A helicopter with three onboard crashed near a crowded beach in the US' Florida. Two people were hospitalised after getting injured in the incident.
