Sharing footage of the incident on Twitter, Miami Beach Police said, "Two occupants have been transported to Jackson Memorial Hospital in stable condition." The beach area has been closed, it added.

349.title: 2 Benin bronzes returned to Nigeria after over 100 years
349.article_body: Two Benin bronzes were returned to Oba Palace in Nigeria's Benin City on Saturday after they were taken by British troops over 100 years ago. The artefacts were created from at least 16th century onwards, according to the British Museum. "They are not just art but they are things that underline the significance of our spirituality," a palace spokesperson said.

350.title: Celebrities like Vicky, Sara come to me for preparation: Martial arts trainer
350.article_body: Martial artist Harshh Verma said that many celebrities like Vicky Kaushal, Sara Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon come to his school for the preparations of their films. "Sara and Vicky trained like warriors, and their characters had demand of their persona...They trained in weapons flexibility reflexes of action-reaction...mainly becoming one with their weapon...making it part of their body," he said.

351.title: 8 people on way to attend wedding killed as car falls into river in Rajasthan's Kota
351.article_body: Eight people died after the car they were travelling in lost control and fell off a small culvert and into the Chambal river in Rajasthan's Kota, as per reports. The incident took place when the occupants of the car were on their way to attend a wedding. The car was reportedly retrieved from water with the help of a crane.

352.title: Natural Diamond Council’s new campaign says 'Thank You'
352.article_body: According to Natural Diamond Council, the purchase of a natural diamond supports the livelihoods of over 2 million Indians, provides insurance covers to more than 650,000 people and sustains communities. With this new initiative, NDC and GJEPC aim to express gratitude to everyone who bought a natural diamond by highlighting the positive socio-economic and environmental impact of the industry.

353.title: We're having a problem with China: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar in Germany
353.article_body: Addressing a security conference in Germany, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "We're having a problem with China." He said, "The problem is that for 45 years there was peace...That changed because we had agreements not to bring military forces to LAC but China violated those agreements." The minister added, "Relations with China are going through a very difficult phase."

354.title: Don't want to discuss personal life: Ammy Virk on reports that he's married & has a child
354.article_body: Reacting to reports that he is married and has a two-year-old daughter, singer-actor Ammy Virk said, "It is my personal life and I don't want to discuss it with anyone." He added, "Whenever we will disclose it, we will reveal everything. Whether I’m married or I’ve a kid or how many I have, I will talk about everything."

355.title: Singer Afsana Khan gets married to singer Saajz, shares pics
355.article_body: Singer Afsana Khan, who participated in 'Bigg Boss 15' last year, tied the knot with singer Saajz on Saturday. Several other Bigg Boss participants like Rakhi Sawant, Umar Riaz, Himanshi Khurana, Rashami Desai and Yuvika Chaudhary attended her wedding. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Afsana wrote, "Our happily ever after begins now."

356.title: PM Modi greets people of Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram on Statehood Day
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday greeted Arunachal Pradesh and Mizoram's people on their Statehood Day. "People of Arunachal Pradesh are known for their stupendous talent and hardworking nature. May the state scale new heights of development in times to come," he tweeted. "India takes great pride in the vibrant Mizo culture and contributions of Mizoram to national progress," he added.

357.title: We wish we could've known him: Priyanka's father-in-law on her late father
357.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu Chopra on Saturday shared a post on Instagram, remembering her late husband Ashok Chopra on their wedding anniversary. Sharing an old picture, she wrote, "A beautiful journey. Blessed." Priyanka's father-in-law Paul Kevin Jonas Sr reacted to her post, writing, "Happy anniversary! We wish we could've known him. Thankful for you and Priyanka in our lives."

358.title: I want to be with someone who allows me to change: Ananya
358.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said in an interview that she wants to be in a relationship that allows her to be herself. "I want to be with someone who allows me to change and keep growing and discovering who I am as a person," she added. "I've changed a lot since I had started...and I want to continue changing," said Ananya.

359.title: Pune builder looking for firearm licence cheated of ₹10 lakh
359.article_body: A Pune-based builder was allegedly cheated of ₹10 lakh by a person who promised to get him a firearm licence. The accused said he had connections in the ministry and collected ₹5 lakh from the victim on two occasions. However, "the complainant's application with Pune police for firearm licence was rejected in 2018," said police. The accused is absconding.

360.title: 8 luxury buses damaged in fire at Gujarat travel company's workshop
360.article_body: Eight luxury buses of Patel Tours and Travels were damaged after a fire broke out at the company's workshop in Gujarat. Fire officials said no casualties were reported. Prima facie, it appears that a bus, which was being painted, caught fire when a welding and cutting process was being carried out on an adjoining bus at the workshop, officials added.

361.title: Pune police arrest man for giving TET candidate list to agents
361.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 33-year-old man for allegedly providing a list of candidates of Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) 2018 to agents who took money for changing final scores. "The list was provided in October 2018 and a payment of ₹80 lakh was made in December 2018," a source close to the investigation was quoted as saying.

362.title: 58 K'taka college students suspended for wearing hijab, protests
362.article_body: At least 58 students from a college in Karnataka's Shivamogga were suspended on Saturday for wearing a hijab and holding a protest demanding that they should be allowed to attend classes. The principal said that they couldn't allow the hijab-wearing students to enter according to the state High Court's interim order. The crowd was dispersed after police intervened.

363.title: Mulayam forced to campaign for son Akhilesh: BJP's Karhal candidate
363.article_body: BJP's Karhal candidate SP Singh Baghel said the SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav was "forcefully" brought to the town this week to campaign for son Akhilesh Yadav. "Mulayam Singh Yadav didn't come to Karhal willingly," Baghel added. "If he was the guardian of SP, then he would've also campaigned for other weaker candidates but he isn't doing that," Baghel stated.

364.title: Channi visits Shiv temple on poll day, says 'I prayed for Punjab'
364.article_body: As voting process started in Punjab on Sunday, state Chief Minister Charanjit Channi visited Shiv temple in Kharar. "Good government should come in Punjab, transparent government should come, there should be chance to run next government with noble policy. I am always seeker for the welfare of all so I prayed for the well being of entire Punjab," Channi said.

365.title: 3 of family burnt alive for resisting house demolition in Bihar, 9 held
365.article_body: Nine people were arrested after three members of family were burnt alive for allegedly protesting against demolition of their house in Bihar's Darbhanga. "Three members of  family were burnt alive for protesting the demolition of their house. Two people, including main accused, were arrested in Darbhanga last night. A total of nine accused have been arrested so far," police said.

366.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 20,000-mark; 673 deaths reported in 24 hours
366.article_body: India has reported 19,968 new COVID-19 cases and 673 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 673 deaths, 261 deaths were reported during the day in the country, while as many as 412 are reconciled deaths reported in Kerala. India's active caseload stood at 2,24,187.

367.title: James Faulkner banned for life from PSL after PCB deny non-payment allegations
367.article_body: Australian cricketer James Faulkner has been banned for life from Pakistan Super League (PSL), with Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) refuting allegations of non-payment made against them. The PCB said payment due to Faulkner as per his contract are fully up to date. The board further said Faulkner damaged hotel property and even acted inappropriately with the immigration authorities at airport.

368.title: Bengal student leader dies after being thrown off terrace of 3-storey building
368.article_body: A 28-year-old student leader at West Bengal's Aliah University died after four unidentified persons allegedly pushed him off the terrace of his residence at a three-storey building in Howrah, police said. The victim's father claimed one of the accused was in police uniform and had a gun. Around 500 protesters took out a candle march from the university to Entally.

369.title: 4 with links to Khalistani terrorist groups arrested in Haryana
369.article_body: Haryana Police have arrested at least four people who allegedly are associated with Khalistani terrorist groups in Sonipat on Friday. The police also recovered six weapons, including an AK-47, and 56 live cartridges from their possession. The accused also reportedly admitted to killing a person on the Khalistani terrorist groups' instructions and had received lakhs of rupees from them.

370.title: Ganguly had texted me 'As long as I'm here, you'd be in team': Saha after getting dropped
370.article_body: After being dropped from Test team, wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha revealed after he scored 61* against New Zealand in Kanpur in November 2021, Sourav Ganguly texted him on WhatsApp saying, "As long as I'm here...you'd be in the team." Saha added, "Such a message from BCCI President really boosted my confidence...What I’m struggling to understand is...how things have changed so fast."

371.title: Indian Army uses drones to supply booster doses to forward troops in J&K
371.article_body: Indian Army reportedly used drones to supply booster doses of COVID-19 vaccine to forward troops in areas of Jammu and Kashmir under mission Sanjeevani. Reports suggest a package, that was well padded for protection, was dropped for forward troops in snow-clad areas. Over 1.89 crores precaution doses for the identified categories of beneficiaries for vaccination have been administered in India.

372.title: SP has links with 2008 Ahmedabad serial blast incident: Anurag Thakur
372.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday alleged that the Samajwadi Party (SP) has links with the 2008 Ahmedabad serial bomb blast case. Thakur has asked the SP chief to respond to his allegations. "When it comes to terrorism, BJP has a zero-tolerance policy while the Samajwadi Party gives full protection to terrorists," Thakur added.

373.title: Conjoined twins vote in Punjab elections, given goggles to maintain secrecy of voting
373.article_body: Conjoined twins, Sohna Singh and Mohna Singh, on Sunday cast their votes for the first time in Punjab Assembly elections as separate voters. Inmates of an orphanage in Amritsar, the two were abandoned by their biological parents in a Delhi hospital after their birth. An official said that goggles were arranged for the twins to maintain the secrecy of voting.

374.title: Woman gets injured resisting snatching in Delhi, dies in hospital
374.article_body: A 40-year-old woman who went comatose after suffering a brain haemorrhage while resisting a snatching bid in Delhi died in hospital 12 days after the incident. The victim fell off an e-rickshaw on her way to attend a wedding when two bike-borne men snatched her bag. The perpetrators were arrested and will be charged with murder, said police.

375.title: Man arrested for threatening ex-boss by posing as gangster in Gurugram
375.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly making extortion calls to his former employer, a businessman based in Gurugram, by posing as a member of the notorious Neeraj Bawana gang. The businessman said he got calls threatening to shoot him outside his Rohtak factory. According to police, the accused was recently fired from the job for his involvement in criminal activities.

376.title: Assam govt to hand over few drug cases to NCB: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
376.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the state government is handing over a few drug cases to the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB). "The step has been taken to establish forward and backward linkages that are not in our jurisdiction," Sarma added. "We hope that Assam becomes a role model after five years," Sarma stated.

377.title: BJP will strive for UP to be among safest, most educated states: Amit Shah
377.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the BJP aims to take Uttar Pradesh to the top of the list of safest, most educated and prosperous states. "After 2014, (PM) Modiji made many efforts to take Uttar Pradesh forward but the SP government was a major obstacle in those efforts," Shah added.

378.title: 2 policemen arrested, another wanted in robbery and extortion case in Mumbai
378.article_body: Two police officers have been arrested while another police inspector is wanted for allegedly robbing a few Angadia service providers and extorting money from them in Mumbai's Bhuleshwar. The policemen had allegedly illegally detained them and threatened to inform the Income Tax Department about their business transactions. The arrested officers were remanded to police custody till February 21.

379.title: Akshay to star in remake of Suriya's 'Soorarai Pottru', confirms Paresh Rawal
379.article_body: Akshay Kumar has been roped in to play the lead role in the Hindi remake of 'Soorarai Pottru', confirmed Paresh Rawal, who starred in the original film. The 66-year-old actor added that he'll also star in the remake. "My role is...same, I being in opposition, is one who tries to sabotage his airlines," Paresh added. 'Soorarai Pottru' also featured Suriya.

380.title: Don't like PDA, may not be able to hold hand in public: Siddhant on girlfriend
380.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has reportedly revealed that he is not single in real life but he wants to keep his relationship under wraps. "I like simple things. I'm very shy, I don't like PDA and may not be able to hold (her) hand in public," he said, adding, "Showing it in front of world is not my piece of cake."

381.title: Hyderabad SHE Teams conduct women-centric awareness programme in metro
381.article_body: The SHE Teams in Hyderabad conducted awareness programmes in metro trains. The Hyderabad police took to social media to share pictures of volunteers holding up posters in the metro, amongst commuters. The posters can be seen saying, "Stop violence against women." One of the posters also said, "The power of change is in our hands."

382.title: Wriddhiman Saha shares screenshot of WhatsApp messages from journalist threatening him
382.article_body: Wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha took to Twitter to share screenshot of WhatsApp messages he received from a journalist after being dropped from India Test team. In the chat, the journalist threatens Saha that he'd never interview him as the wicketkeeper didn't call him. "After all of my contributions to Indian cricket..this is what I face...from a so-called 'Respected' journalist!" Saha wrote.

383.title: Daily COVID-19 cases fall to 646 in Bengaluru, 8 deaths reported
383.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases in Bengaluru dropped to 646 on Saturday with eight deaths reported, according to official data. The city also recorded 1,901 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 2.25%, data showed. The number of active containment zones in the city has dropped to 18, with Bommanahalli having the highest at 10, data also showed.

384.title: 2 dead, 3 injured as speeding Mercedes car rams into moving truck in Delhi
384.article_body: Two men died and three sustained grievous injuries after the Mercedes car they were travelling in crashed into the rear-end of a moving truck on a flyover in Delhi's Palam on Saturday, police said. The car's occupants, aged between 19 and 21, were returning from a wedding in Faridabad. CCTV cameras are being checked to identify and trace the truck.

385.title: 2 killed, 5 hurt in multi-vehicle crash on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
385.article_body: Two people were killed and five others were injured after a trailer truck lost control and crashed into four cars before turning turtle on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway on Saturday. The two deceased are the driver and cleaner of the trailer truck, an official said. The injured people have been rushed to hospitals in Khopoli and Navi Mumbai.

386.title: Youth caught for 'dangerously wheeling' in B'luru, police share video
386.article_body: Bengaluru police officer Savitha S took to Twitter to share video of youth balancing his scooter on one wheel on city roads. "Wheeling dangerously becomes a nightmare to the youngster after being caught by RT Nagar Police today on CBI Road," officer wrote. In another post, she wrote, "The accused youngster caught while dangerously wheeling by RT Nagar Police today."

387.title: Voting underway for all Punjab Assembly seats, 59 UP Assembly seats
387.article_body: Voting for the third phase of UP Assembly elections, in 59 seats, began at 7 am on Sunday, while polling in Punjab started at 8 am. Among the prominent faces contesting in Punjab are CM Charanjit Singh Channi, Navjot Singh Sidhu, Bhagwant Mann, Amarinder Singh, Parkash Singh Badal and Sukhbir Singh Badal. In UP,  Akhilesh Yadav is contesting from Karhal.

388.title: Hyderabad Police issues warning about 'fraudulent' Hyperverse app
388.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday warned people about the Hyperverse app which it said was a "fraudulent app". The police posted a warning on its Twitter page, which read, "Do not invest in Hyperverse app with the greed of making easy money...If you invest, you will be cheated." It also shared Telangana Cybercrime center's helpline number -1930.

389.title: European Union is open to crypto but with regulation: Top official
389.article_body: The European Union is open to cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin or a digital euro but regulations must be strengthened first, said Ylva Johansson, the Commissioner for Home Affairs. Johansson said she's not uncomfortable with digital currencies but they need to be regulated in a proper way, adding that criminal organisations mustn't be allowed to exploit the anonymity allowed by some networks.

390.title: Govt to create equity fund for startups with 20% limited stake: MoS IT
390.article_body: The government will create an equity fund for startups with a 20% limited stake, the Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said at an event conducted by the Confederation of Indian Industry. The fund will be managed by private fund managers, Chandrasekhar said, adding that "this will create required private equity capital as an addition to what exists today".

391.title: Bengal Guv returns CM Mamata's recommendation to convene assembly
391.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday said he has returned CM Mamata Banerjee's recommendation to summon State Assembly from March 7. In a tweet, Dhankhar said that the recommendation was being returned for "constitutional compliance". He added the recommendation wasn't made by the state Cabinet as per the norm. He also attached a letter he wrote to the government.

392.title: President Kovind to review Naval Fleet at Visakhapatnam on Feb 21
392.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, who is also the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces, will be reviewing the Naval Fleet on February 21 at Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. The fleet will include over 60 ships and submarines and 55 aircraft. The President's Yacht, an indigenously built Naval Offshore Patrol Vessel named INS Sumitra, will lead the presidential column in the review.

393.title: It has upset me: Shatrughan Sinha on Punjab CM's 'bhaiye' remark
393.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has said that Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi's 'UP, Bihar de Bhaiye' remark has upset him. He tweeted, "Being a Bihari Babu, it hasn't just upset me but hurt many people from other states, UP, Bihar and Delhi too." He added that being a public figure the CM "must know how to conduct himself".

394.title: Man drowns himself over harassment by wife & in-laws in Rajasthan
394.article_body: A 28-year-old man died by suicide by jumping into a pond on Saturday after allegedly being harassed by his wife and in-laws in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district. The deceased also recorded a testimony in a video before jumping into the Ransagar pond, Sadar Police Station SHO Hazarilal said. A case has been registered under Section 174 of the CrPC.

395.title: Iran ready for immediate prisoner swap with US: Foreign Minister
395.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian on Saturday said that Iran is ready for an immediate swap of prisoners with the US. "We believe prisoner swaps is a humanitarian issue...unrelated to the nuclear accord," he added. He further said that the West would be to blame if the ongoing talks in Vienna to revive the 2015 nuclear deal fail.

396.title: EU sends emergency medical equipment to Ukraine amid border crisis
396.article_body: The European Commission on Saturday said that the European Union (EU) has delivered emergency medical equipment to Ukraine following a request from the Ukrainian government. So far emergency aid has come from France, Romania, Slovenia, Ireland and Austria, the Commission added. The request was made amid rising fears of an imminent Russian invasion of Ukraine.

397.title: Actor's innings longer than a star's: Bobby on 45 years in B'wood
397.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, who has completed 45 years in Bollywood, has said that an actor's innings is longer than a star's if the work is appreciated. "Hard work and focus have brought me here today. I have evolved with time," he said. Bobby made his acting debut in 1977 as a child artiste in 'Dharam Veer'.

398.title: Alliance with SP will win over 300 seats in UP: Shivpal Yadav
398.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohiya) chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday said their coalition with Samajwadi Party will win over 300 seats in UP. He added, "BJP will get to know the reality on March 10."  Further, talking about Karhal seat from where his nephew and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav is contesting, he said there is no competition there with BJP.

399.title: Liverpool beat Norwich, Arsenal beat Brentford in Premier League
399.article_body: Liverpool on Saturday beat Norwich 3-1 in the Premier League, with Arsenal beating Brentford 2-1. Crystal Palace lost 0-1 to third-place Chelsea. Liverpool cut Manchester City's lead at the top of the Premier League table to six points. Elsewhere, Brighton were beaten 0-3 by Burnley and Southampton beat Everton 2-0. West Ham United drew 1-1 with Newcastle United.

400.title: I, as a woman who wears hijab, resent women being harassed: Zaira on hijab controversy
400.article_body: Zaira Wasim, speaking on hijab controversy, said, "The inherited notion of hijab being a choice is an ill informed one. It's often either a construct of convenience or ignorance." "A woman who wears hijab is fulfilling an obligation enjoined upon her by the God she loves...I, as a woman who wears hijab, resent...women...being...harassed for merely carrying out...religious commitment," she added.

401.title: Didn't ask for it, don't want it: Vishvas after getting 'Y' category security
401.article_body: After he was given 'Y' category security by the Centre, former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas said, "Neither [did I ask] for 'Y' category security nor do I want it." He added, "I have not received any message from authorities about the security. It is the work of the agencies and government to think about the security of their citizens."

402.title: Some businesses I invested in had terrible products: Shark Tank's Ghazal
402.article_body: Ghazal Alagh of 'Shark Tank India' has said certain businesses that she invested in turned out to have terrible products. "There have been deals where you...loved their products, but then you...checked those products [on internet] and you go like, 'What do you do now'," she said. "Now [if] products don't have a good rating, it is your problem," she added.

403.title: Deactivated Twitter account after getting threats: Vivek Agnihotri
403.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri has deactivated his Twitter account after allegedly receiving threats to stop release of his film 'The Kashmir Files'. "My DM was filled with vulgar and threatening messages (by you know who)," Vivek said in a post. "It's not that I can't handle such elements, but it seemed there were many Pakistani and Chinese bots," he added.

404.title: Rohit Sharma is the number one cricketer of our country: Chief selector Chetan Sharma
404.article_body: After naming Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain, chief selector Chetan Sharma said, "He is the number one cricketer of our country." Chetan added, "If such a big and experienced cricketer comes forward and becomes captain then the future captains to be groomed under Rohit would be a tremendous thing for us." Rohit is now India's all-format captain.

405.title: 'Gehraiyaan' was draining, had to lighten up after cut: Siddhant
405.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has said working in 'Gehraiyaan' was taxing and draining for him. "That's why we've had so much of fun on the set. Because after cut...we had to lighten it up," Siddhant said. "We were so drained in the scene, we wanted to talk good things, look at memes and just laugh it out," he added.

406.title: Disagree with some of her choices: Deepika on 'Gehraiyaan' role
406.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said she does not agree with some of the choices her character makes in 'Gehraiyaan'. She said she still wanted to portray her as someone viewers could relate to and not judge. "As an actor, I have to step out of that lens of judgement...there is a reason why people do what they do," she added.

407.title: It feels like a computer game: Mark Wood on ₹7.5-crore IPL contract
407.article_body: Talking about being bought by Lucknow Super Giants for ₹7.5 crore in the IPL mega auction, England fast bowler Mark Wood said, "It's a weird experience. It feels like a computer game, almost not real." He added, "[It feels like] transfers on Football Manager [video game], but it's also very real when you get signed."

408.title: PM wears traditional Afghan attire & says 'Karzai will be happiest'; Karzai reacts
408.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi wore the traditional Afghan attire Chapan gifted to him by Afghanistani Hindu-Sikhs in Delhi, he said, "When (former Afghan President) Hamid Karzai sahab will see this, he'll be the happiest." Karzai reacted to it by thanking PM Modi for the "kind gesture" and added, "Best wishes to Your Excellency and the friendly people of India."

409.title: Alia, Malia, Jamalia beheaded soldiers: Shah on Manmohan govt
409.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday criticised the former UPA government, saying PM didn't do anything when "Alia, Malia, Jamalia used to enter India and behead our soldiers". "Till 10 years, the Sonia-Manmohan Singh government was at the Centre...Yet, the PM couldn't do anything," he said. His comments came days after former PM Manmohan Singh criticised the BJP-led Centre.

410.title: 32,000 candidates to appear for 9,017 vacancies in Assam Police
410.article_body: A total of 32,720 candidates will appear in the written examination for 9,017 posts of constables in the Assam Police on Sunday. Assam Police DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said that all arrangements had been made for the smooth conduct of the examination. The State Level Police Recruitment Board (SLPRB) is conducting the examination.

411.title: US ends ban on Mexican avocado imports, will resume immediately
411.article_body: The US Department of Agriculture (USDA) on Friday announced an end to a ban on avocado imports from the Mexican state of Michoacan, with imports resuming immediately. The US' agricultural inspection program was halted on February 11 after a US inspector was verbally threatened. As per the USDA, the US in 2021 imported avocados worth $2.8 billion from Mexico.

412.title: New Northern Army Commander arrives in Ladakh on his maiden visit
412.article_body: Northern Army Commander Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi on Saturday reached Leh on his four-day maiden visit to the Union Territory of Ladakh after taking over the Udhampur-based command on February 1, a spokesperson said. Dwivedi is expected to visit forward areas in the entire Ladakh sector and receive a briefing from officers on the ground, the spokesperson added.

413.title: UP CM doesn't know anything: Akhilesh on blast convict link remark
413.article_body: SP President Akhilesh Yadav reacting to UP CM Yogi Adityanath's allegations that the family of Ahmedabad serial blasts convict had links to SP, said, "Humare baba mukhyamantri kamaal ke hain (Our CM is wonderful)." He added that CM didn't know anything earlier, doesn't know anything now. UP election is about farmers' rights, employment for youth and state's development, Yadav said.

414.title: This is absolutely nonsense: Rangnick on rift over Man Utd captaincy
414.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick on Friday dismissed rumours of a rift over the captaincy role at the club between Harry Maguire and Cristiano Ronaldo, adding that the media reports are "absolutely nonsense". Manchester United travel to face Leeds United in the Premier League on Sunday. "Harry is our captain and he will stay our captain," Rangnick added.

415.title: He made me a better player, person: Fernandes on Man Utd teammate Mata
415.article_body: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes on Saturday said teammate Juan Mata is his best friend at the club, adding that Mata helped him "grow up to be a better player and a better person also". Fernandes joined United in 2020, while Mata has been at the club since 2014. Mata's contract at United expires at the end of the season.

416.title: World no. 5 Nadal receives 5th Stefan Edberg Sportsmanship Award
416.article_body: World number five Rafael Nadal received his fifth Stefan Edberg Sportsmanship Award, after being selected by fellow ATP players to win the award for the 2021 season in December. The award recognises Nadal's professionalism, fair play and integrity on and off the court. The trophy is now on display at the Rafa Nadal Museum at the Spaniard's academy in Mallorca.

417.title: World no. 1 Djokovic to face Musetti in Dubai on return to tennis
417.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic will face Italy's Lorenzo Musetti in the first round of the Dubai Tennis Championships after being deported from Australia last month due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. "The government here does not require someone to be vaccinated to enter the country," Dubai tournament Director Salah Tahlak said. Djokovic has won the event five times.

418.title: Will break knee of anyone demanding Cooch Behar state: TMC MLA
418.article_body: TMC MLA Udayan Guha has threatened to break the knees of those demanding separate statehood for West Bengal's Cooch Behar district. Notably, Guha's comment comes after BJP MLA Malati Rava claimed that lack of development by successive Left Front and TMC governments was triggering separatist demands among the people of Cooch Behar. "I dare...Guha to break my leg," Rava said.

419.title: France advises nationals to leave 3 Ukrainian regions amid crisis
419.article_body: French foreign ministry on Saturday advised its nationals to leave the Ukrainian regions of Kharkiv, Luhansk and Donetsk without delay amid rise in Russian military buildup near Ukraine. The ministry also urged citizens in Ukraine to leave if they do not have urgent business in the country. Meanwhile, Russia has deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops in and near Ukraine.

420.title: 3 colleges shut down abruptly in Canada; advisory issued for Indian students
420.article_body: The Indian High Commission in Canada has issued an advisory for Indian students affected by the abrupt closure of three colleges in the country. "High Commission has been approached by several students...In the event that they find any difficulty in reimbursement of their fees...they may file a complaint with Ministry of Higher Education, Government of Quebec," the advisory stated.

421.title: TN BJP agent arrested as he objects to hijab-wearing woman while voting
421.article_body: A polling agent of the BJP, Girirajan, has been arrested after he objected to a woman, who was wearing a hijab while voting in Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Saturday. He reportedly asked the woman to take the hijab off. He said, "I cannot accept this...How can I cross verify the person wearing hijab with the photos in this (voters) list?"

422.title: India is your home: PM Modi to Afghan Hindu-Sikh delegation
422.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday met members of a Hindu-Sikh delegation from Afghanistan at his residence in New Delhi. "You are not guests but in your own house, India is your home," a statement by the PMO quoted him as saying. The PM also spoke about the significance of the Citizenship Amendment Act and its benefits for the community.

423.title: Mexican army troops deployed to remove land mines placed by cartels
423.article_body: Special Mexican army units on Friday were deployed to clear out land mines placed by warring drug cartels as part of a turf war in the region of Aguililla. The anti-mine squads have found dozens of land mines along rural fields and roads. One farmer was killed last week by a mine after driving over it in his pickup truck.

424.title: Karnataka Congress to resume Mekedatu rally from February 27
424.article_body: Karnataka Congress leaders have said the party will resume the Mekedatu rally from February 27 and it will conclude in Bengaluru on March 3. The rally was suspended in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases. The rally aims to pressurise the BJP-run state government to implement the Mekedatu project to regulate water flow to neighbouring Tamil Nadu.

425.title: Canadian police arrest at least 100 'Freedom Convoy' protesters
425.article_body: Canadian police on Friday arrested at least 100 protesters, part of the three-week "Freedom Convoy" against COVID-19 vaccine mandate and restrictions in Ottawa. Authorities said nearly two dozen vehicles were also towed. Four of the protest leaders are among those who have been arrested. "We will work day and night until this is completed," Interim Police Chief Steve Bell said.

426.title: Germany urges nationals to leave Ukraine immediately amid crisis
426.article_body: German foreign ministry on Saturday advised its nationals in Ukraine to leave the country immediately citing a possibility of a "military confrontation" in the region amid rising tensions between West and Russia. The ministry also warned citizens against travelling to Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia launched strategic nuclear drills and massed up to 1.9 lakh troops in and near Ukraine.

427.title: India delivers 2.5 tons of medical aid, clothing to Afghanistan
427.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the country delivered fifth shipment of 2.5 tons of medical assistance and winter clothings to Afghanistan. So far, India has provided 5 lakh COVID-19 vaccine doses and life-saving medicines in three shipments to crisis-torn country. Afghanistan plunged into humanitarian crisis after Taliban took over the country in August last year.

428.title: Satellite pic shows 32 Russian fighter jets at airfield near Ukraine border
428.article_body: Satellite pictures released by US space firm Maxar have shown additional deployment of transport and attack helicopters, air defence units, unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and fighter jets near the Ukraine border by Russia. One satellite picture showed as many as 32 Sukhoi-25 jets at the Luninets airfield in Belarus. At least 50 helicopters have also reportedly been stationed.

429.title: Man sentenced to life for raping mentally challenged woman in Hyderabad
429.article_body: A 36-year-old man was awarded life imprisonment by local court for raping his 28-year-old mentally challenged neighbour in Hyderabad's Meerpet in 2013. The convict had raped the woman while she was sleeping with her family members on the terrace of her house at night and fled the spot before the family member could catch him. Police had later arrested him.

430.title: Gut health gets compromised in severe COVID-19: Study
430.article_body: Researchers of King's College London studied samples of intestines of COVID-19 victims and found its Peyer's Patches to be severely disrupted, indicating impact of the virus on gut immune system. Peyer's patches are lymphoid tissue in the gut responsible for maintaining healthy intestinal microbial populations. These patches were disrupted irrespective of whether virus was present in gut or not.

431.title: Ex-US Prez Trump improperly took away classified items: govt agency
431.article_body: US National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) on Friday said that ex-President Donald Trump improperly took away classified information to his Florida home after leaving the White House. The classified documents were found in 15 boxes of White House records that were stored at Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence. The boxes were recovered by the agency last month.

432.title: Video shows Ranveer reacting to fans shouting 'Apna time aayega' at NBA All-Star Game
432.article_body: A video posted on social media from the NBA All-Star Game in the US shows a section of fans cheering for Ranveer Singh, who was one of the celebrities taking part in the game. They can be heard shouting his 'Gully Boy' phrase 'Apna time aayega (Our time will come)'. Upon hearing them, Ranveer is seen smiling and acknowledging them.

433.title: Rohit Sharma's 3-year-old tweet goes viral after he is made India's all-format captain
433.article_body: Rohit Sharma's three-year-old tweet reading 'Throw me to the wolves and I come back leading the pack' has gone viral after he was announced as India's all-format captain today. Rohit had made the tweet on September 1, 2018 after being asked by a fan about a quote that describes him. "Never give up in life," a fan commented.

434.title: 2 suspended after extra EVM found in UP official's vehicle
434.article_body: After an extra EVM was found in the vehicle of the zonal magistrate, authorities in UP's Shamli district have suspended a police constable and a home guard for alleged negligence. The EVM was found after polling in Kairana on February 10, SP Sukirti Madhav said. The authorities have now written to the Election Commission, recommending action against the zonal magistrate.

435.title: UN Human Rights Chief can visit Xinjiang: Chinese Foreign Minister
435.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Saturday said UN Human Rights Chief Michelle Bachelet can visit Xinjiang but government doesn't welcome any investigation in the region. "China rejects all kinds of biases, prejudices and uncalled-for accusations," Wang stated during Munich Security Conference, This comes as rights groups and US have accused China of committing genocide against ethnic Uyghurs.

436.title: There'll be threat to Taiwan if West doesn't support Ukraine: UK PM
436.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Saturday said if Western allies fail to support Ukraine against the growing Russian aggression, there will be a threat to Taiwan. "People would draw the conclusion that aggression pays, and that might is right," added Johnson. Taiwan is a self-governing island nation near China which it claims as its own territory.

437.title: Shikhar Dhawan shares video on meeting son after 2 years, says 'very emotional moments'
437.article_body: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan shared a video on Instagram after meeting his son Zoravar after two years. "Two long years since I met my son. Uske saath khelna, usko gale lagaana, baatein karna.. bohot emotional moments hain ye (Playing with him, hugging him, talking with him...are very emotional moments)," he wrote. The video shows him hugging his son.

438.title: No party other than BJP had spine to remove triple talaq: Nadda
438.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday said in UP that no party other than BJP "had the spine" to remove triple talaq as they only indulged in appeasement politics. He further praised PM Narendra Modi for bringing in the law against it saying, "[He] brought the SC's order in...Parliament to get rid of it and give freedom to Muslim sisters."

439.title: BJP turns people against people: Kanimozhi on K'taka Hijab row
439.article_body: Speaking to reporters about the ongoing Hijab row in Karnataka, Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) MP, Kanimozhi alleged that BJP leaders "turn people against people in the name of religion". She added, "What a woman chooses to wear is her right, I don't think anybody has the right to decide whether it is too much or too little."

440.title: Suicide bomb blast kills 15, injures 20 in Somalia
440.article_body: A suicide bomb blast at a crowded restaurant in Somalia's Beledweyne on Saturday left at least 15 people dead and 20 others injured, the police said. The al-Shabaab militant group claimed responsibility for the attack, according to a report by SITE intelligence. The explosion comes amid Somalia's parliamentary elections that are due to be completed by February 25.

441.title: Farhan, Shibani dance as Shankar Mahadevan sings 'Dil Chahta Hai' at wedding
441.article_body: Video showing Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar dancing with their wedding guests as singer Shankar Mahadevan sang 'Dil Chahta Hai', has surfaced online. The song was featured in the 2001 movie by the same name that was directed by Akhtar. The wedding took place at his parents Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's Khandala farmhouse.

442.title: Before Punjab polls, FIR ordered against AAP & Kejriwal for violating EC's rules
442.article_body: Punjab's Chief Electoral Officer has ordered to register an FIR against AAP and its chief Arvind Kejriwal for allegedly violating the Model Code of Conduct and for "making false and frivolous allegations against other political parties". The action was ordered after a SAD leader raised an objection to a video uploaded by AAP, saying it maligns SAD and other parties.

443.title: We're your 'baap': Raut to Rane after he talks about ED notice
443.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday told Union Minister Narayan Rane, "We are your 'baap (father)'." His remarks came after Rane said he has information that an ED notice is ready for four persons in Matoshree, the residence of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. "Rane is threatening us that he has our horoscope...We too have your horoscope," Raut added.

444.title: Gladdening: PM on India hosting 2023 Int'l Olympic Committee Session
444.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed happiness after India won the right to host the 2023 International Olympic Committee (IOC) Session in Mumbai. Taking to Twitter, he said, "It is gladdening...I am confident this will be a memorable IOC session and will lead to positive outcomes for world sports." Notably, India last hosted an IOC session in 1983 in Delhi.

445.title: Storm Eunice kills at least 9 in Europe; 4 lakh in UK without power
445.article_body: At least nine people were killed across Europe on Friday by Storm Eunice, leaving about 4 lakh people in Britain without power. Toppled trees killed four people in the Netherlands and a man in Liverpool was killed by flying debris. The Met Office recorded a 196 kmph gust of wind as over 400 flights were reportedly cancelled across the UK.

446.title: Future Retail pays $14 mn interest on USD notes in grace period
446.article_body: Future Retail has paid $14 million for interest due on the dollar-denominated notes (USD notes) listed on Singapore stock exchange after missing the due date last month. The company told the NSE last month that it had 30 days to make the payment. Future Retail had cited continued impact of COVID-19 and its financial situation as reasons for missing payment.

447.title: Govt gets 5 proposals worth ₹1.5 lakh crore for chip, display plants
447.article_body: The government has received five applications for the establishment of semiconductor and display plants under its ₹76,000 crore PLI scheme. The Ministry of Electronics and IT said the companies have proposed to invest a total of $20.5 billion (₹1.53 lakh crore). Vedanta-Foxconn JV, IGSS Ventures and ISMC have proposed to set up semiconductor plants with a total $13.6 billion investment.

448.title: Kerala's plan to build new Mullaperiyar Dam arbitrary: Tamil Nadu
448.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday said Kerala's announcement to construct a new reservoir in place of existing Mullaperiyar Dam was "arbitrary and amounted to contempt of Supreme Court order". Water Resources Minister S Duraimurugan said Tamil Nadu will oppose it in all aspects. He said the state's rights over Mullaperiyar will not be given up for any reason.

449.title: Australia reports 43 COVID-19 deaths ahead of border reopening
449.article_body: Australia on Saturday reported 43 COVID-19 deaths ahead of its border reopening for international tourists on February 21. Australia shut its borders in March 2020 when the pandemic began and has slowly reopened its borders since November, first allowing Australians, then workers and international students to travel. Fully vaccinated travellers do not have to quarantine upon arrival.

450.title: Ex-Police Commissioner criticises 'Gehraiyaan', Mazumdar-Shaw says 'Watch whole film'
450.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao criticised 'Gehraiyaan' and tweeted, "We started watching [it], 20 minutes later, stopped." "I'm fan of Deepika...she's idolized by millions...Extramarital and destruction of home...Wrong message. Am I old fashioned[?]" he said. "Watch the whole film it's really well made with...twists," Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw replied.

451.title: Bulldozers under repair, will resume work after March 10: UP CM
451.article_body: Talking about action on criminals, UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said all bulldozers have been sent for repair and would resume work after March 10. "A senior SP leader asked me if bulldozers will be operated during the polls too," Yogi said. "I told him not to worry as sometimes these bulldozers also need some rest," he added.

452.title: US Defence Secretary says Russia is ‘poised to strike’ Ukraine
452.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin on Saturday said Russia is "poised to strike" Ukraine, following a massive military buildup of troops near the border. "Having done this before, I can tell you that is exactly what you need to attack and the stance that you need to be in to attack," Austin said while visiting Lithuania's capital, Vilnius.

453.title: 2 Congress sarpanches booked for SAD worker's murder in Punjab
453.article_body: Two Congress sarpanches were on Friday booked for the murder of SAD worker Karamjit Singh in Punjab's Fatehgarh Churian on the last day of poll campaigning. The police said an argument started between SAD workers and Congress sarpanches over a roadshow by local SAD candidate. "During the brawl, (Sarpanches) Tajinderpal Singh and Jaswant Singh...hit Karamjit with baseball bats," police said.

454.title: Kejriwal couldn't have Khalistan connection: Tikait on Vishwas' remark
454.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait has reacted to allegations made by ex-AAP leader Kumar Vishwas, who alleged AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal was supportive of the Punjab Khalistan movement. Tikait said that Kejriwal is a "political agitator, but he couldn't possibly have any Khalistan connection". Vishwas had alleged that Kejriwal had told him that he'll either become Punjab CM or Khalistan PM.

455.title: Kanye asks court to reject Kim's request to be declared legally single
455.article_body: Lawyers for rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, have filed court documents asking a judge to deny a motion by his estranged wife Kim Kardashian to declare her legally single. "Terminating marital status before custody, property, support issues are resolved creates risk of adverse consequences," said Ye's attorneys. Kim filed for termination of her marital status in December 2021.

456.title: Russia makes demands that it knows NATO cannot fulfil: Stoltenberg
456.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Saturday said that Russia is "putting forward demands they know we cannot meet". "This is a new normal, that we have a Russia which is openly contesting core values for European security and then demonstrating their will to use force," he added. Stoltenberg was speaking at the Munich Security Conference.

457.title: Optical illusion asking people what number they can see goes viral
457.article_body: An optical illusion has gone viral, with social media users seeing it differently. A Twitter user posted an optical illusion involving numbers hidden in a black and white swirl and asked, "Do you see a number? If so, what number?"  Several people came up with different answers, with some users saying they saw 528 and others saying they saw 3452839.

458.title: UP will supply terrorism all over India if SP forms its govt: Shah
458.article_body: Ahead of the third phase of polling in the ongoing Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that UP would "supply terrorism all over the country" if the Samajwadi Party forms its government. During a public event in UP's Banda district, Shah alleged that 2,000 farmers died out of hunger during famine under Akhilesh Yadav's government.

459.title: Federal, province elections to be held after local polls: Nepal PM
459.article_body: Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on Saturday announced that the federal and province elections will be held after local level polls. "All three elections should be held in environment that is free of fear as well as any kind of anomalies," said Deuba. Deuba made the announcement during his address to the nation on the occasion of 72nd Democracy Day.

460.title: He was a superhero to me: Mercedes' new F1 driver Russell on Hamilton
460.article_body: Mercedes' new Formula One driver George Russell on Friday admitted during the digital launch of Mercedes' 2022 F1 car, that the seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton was a childhood superhero of his growing up. Russell added it will be "a real privilege to race alongside Lewis" having joined Mercedes' F1 team in 2021 after spending three years racing with Williams.

461.title: NASA's Perseverance rover completes first year on Mars
461.article_body: NASA's Perseverance rover completed first year on Mars after it landed on the planet on February 18, 2021. During the past year, the six-wheeled rover accomplished many firsts such as collection of rock core samples and extraction of oxygen. It also recently broke record for most distance driven in a single day by travelling almost 320 meters on February 14.

462.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer performs viral song at hotel in Kolkata, video surfaces
462.article_body: Bhuban Badyakar, whose 'Kacha Badam' song went viral on social media, was seen performing the song at a hotel in West Bengal's Kolkata. The video shows people singing along with Badyakar as he performed. He received ₹3 lakh from Godhuli Bela Music, which is the label that remixed his song.

463.title: Thane woman claims rickshaw co-passenger stole her jewellery worth ₹7 lakh
463.article_body: A 57-year-old woman lodged a police complaint in Thane alleging that a co-passenger in her autorickshaw stole her gold jewellery worth ₹7.30 lakh on Thursday. The victim was on her way to attend a wedding when the alleged accused boarded her autorickshaw and sat close to her. A probe has been launched, said police.

464.title: UK PM Johnson urges unity from Western allies amid Ukraine crisis
464.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson urged the Western allies for "an overwhelming display of Western solidarity" against a potential Russian invasion of Ukraine. "And that unity is absolutely vital if we're going to deter... an absolutely catastrophic act of aggression by Vladimir Putin," added Johnson. This comes as Russia deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops in and near Ukraine.

465.title: James Faulkner allegedly throws helmet on chandelier amid rift with PCB, pic surfaces
465.article_body: Australian cricketer James Faulkner allegedly threw a helmet onto chandelier at Lahore hotel amid rift with Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) reportedly over a payment dispute. Faulkner, who announced his decision to leave PSL midway, threw his bat and helmet after a discussion with a PCB official before leaving for airport, ESPNcricinfo reported. Faulkner termed his treatment by PCB "a disgrace".

466.title: Russia has signalled it is open to talks: Scholz amid Ukraine crisis
466.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Saturday said Russia has signalled it is open to negotiate both during his meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russia's response to US security proposals. During the Munich Security Conference, he stated the West is ready to negotiate over Russia's demands "without being naive". Meanwhile, Putin has ordered strategic drills involving nuclear missiles.

467.title: Ranveer shares pics with 7-ft-6-inch tall Tacko, says 'How will I shoot over him?'
467.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who played the NBA All-Star Game with other celebrities, shared pictures with Senegalese basketball player Elhadji Tacko Fall. "How am I supposed to shoot over this guy?" he wrote in one of the pictures shared with the 7-foot-6-inch tall basketball player. "I...had the most incredible experience at the All-Star Game," Ranveer wrote in another Story.

468.title: 35-yr-old Meta exec admits having sex chats with 13-yr-old boy, no longer part of firm
468.article_body: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, has said that its manager of global community development Jeren Miles is no longer part of the company after a sting operation showed him admitting to having sex chats with a 13-year-old boy. The 35-year-old has deleted his profiles on sites like Facebook and Twitter. "We're actively investigating this situation," a Meta spokesperson said.

469.title: BBMP invites suggestions from public for upcoming Budget for B'luru
469.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has invited suggestions and instructions of the public for the upcoming Budget 2022-23 for the city. BBMP said that a suggestion box has been placed near the BBMP office and said that general public can give their suggestions through the box. Bengaluru's Budget is usually announced 15 days after the state Budget is presented.

470.title: Pune's PCMC presents 6,497-crore draft budget
470.article_body: The ₹6,497-crore draft budget of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) was presented by Additional Commissioner Vikas Dhakane on Friday. Notably, the budget was presented in Commissioner Rajesh Patil's absence, drawing protests from some corporators. This is the first time in PCMC's history that the Commissioner stayed away from the budget presentation, a Standing Committee member said.

471.title: FIR against 3 Mumbai policemen for extorting money from Angadias
471.article_body: An FIR has been registered by Mumbai Police against three officers after several complaints were received from Angadias' Association of Bhuleshwar. The association, which offers courier services, alleged the accused restrained Angadias and their employees and extorted money after taking them to Mumbadevi Chowky. The crime branch has arrested two officers and the third is wanted, an official said.

472.title: All rival dals will be confined to daldal after UP polls: UP Dy CM
472.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Saturday said that all other dals (parties) will be confined to a daldal (swamp) after the results are declared and the lotus will bloom in it. The BJP will win over 300 of the 403 assembly seats, he added. The party will also win 60% of votes in state elections, he further said.

473.title: Kumar Vishvas given 'Y' category security days after his remark on Kejriwal
473.article_body: Poet and former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas has been granted 'Y' category security with CRPF cover, days after he alleged that AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal was supportive of Punjab Khalistan movement. As per reports, the decision was taken based on Intelligence Bureau's threat perception. The 'Y' category security cover involves the deputation of eight security personnel for a person's protection.

474.title: Prashant Kishor meets Nitish Kumar 2 years after quitting JD(U)
474.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar met on Friday in Delhi. The two met for the first time since January 2020, when Kumar sacked Kishor from JD(U). When asked about his meeting with Kishor, Kumar replied, "Is my relationship with Prashant Kishor only from today? There is no special meaning behind the meeting."

475.title: CCTV captures moment a driver is run over by own truck while urinating in TN
475.article_body: A truck driver in Tamil Nadu died after he was run over by his own truck that was parked at a petrol pump on Friday, with police saying that the man had not applied the truck's handbrake. A CCTV footage of the incident shows the man getting out of his truck and urinating when the vehicle started moving towards him.

476.title: PM likely to inaugurate metro project during visit to Pune on Mar 6
476.article_body: PM Narendra Modi is likely to visit Pune on March 6 to inaugurate Pune Metro project between Vanaz-Garware College and PCMC-Phugewadi. Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol reportedly said, "It's...proud thing that PM Modi has given time for the inauguration of the metro project on March 6." PM Modi is likely to address a public rally on the same day in Pune.

477.title: James Faulkner leaves PSL over payment dispute, calls treatment by PCB 'a disgrace'
477.article_body: Australian bowling all-rounder James Faulkner has left the Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 prematurely over a payment dispute. Faulkner, who represents Quetta Gladiators, said Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) didn't honour his "contractual agreement/payments", adding, "I've been here the whole duration and they have continued to lie to me." He called the treatment he received by PCB "a disgrace".

478.title: Chinese warship fired laser at patrol plane: Australian govt
478.article_body: Australian Defence Department on Saturday said a Chinese warship fired laser at one of its surveillance aircraft potentially endangering lives. "We strongly condemn unprofessional and unsafe military conduct," department added. The authorities said Chinese naval vessel was accompanied by another warship. Reportedly, Australian pilots were attacked by Chinese warships in a similar manner in 2019.

479.title: Kerala to create 15,000 startups, 2 lakh jobs in 5 yrs: CM Vijayan
479.article_body: Kerala aims to create 15,000 startups and 2 lakh jobs in the next five years, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said. Speaking at the Huddle Global 2022 event, Vijayan said the state government plans to set up an emerging technology startup hub in Thiruvananthapuram. "Startups being the future of the country, Kerala is committed to providing the right ecosystem," he added.

480.title: Experts visit Japan's nuclear plant, review water release plan
480.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) experts visited Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant this week to review government's plan to release over a million tons of treated radioactive water into the ocean. Team monitored water samples from tanks and said a gradual release of water diluted with seawater over decades is safe. In 2011, a massive tsunami destroyed the plant's three reactors.

481.title: 'Vote for Cong but not AAP,' says Punjab BJP chief; later clarifies
481.article_body:
Punjab BJP chief Ashwani Sharma recently asked voters to vote for Congress, if they aren't voting for BJP, but not for AAP. "A vote for AAP means a vote for terrorism," he reportedly said. Later, he claimed his words were twisted and taken out of context. 
"AAP or Congress cannot benefit Punjab and are dangerous for the state," he added.

482.title: 4 more towers of Gurugram society, where flats collapsed, unfit for living
482.article_body: Four more towers, namely E, F, G and H, of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso society have been declared unfit for living. Chintels Paradiso is the same society where a few flats had collapsed on February 10. In some houses, the iron rods in ceilings are visible while in others plaster is falling. The residents were asked to shift to alternative accommodations.

483.title: 3 of the 11 PMC-owned auditoriums lack maintenance: Pune civic body
483.article_body: Theatre production managers have held a meeting with Pune Municipal Corporation to raise the problems, including issues of cleanliness and air-conditioning, in the PMC-owned auditoriums in Pune. Following their complaint, the PMC checked all 11 auditoriums and said that apart from cleanliness, only three auditoriums had problems and lacked maintenance and said that they will resolve the problems.

484.title: 2 minor girls injured as speeding car rams into them in Ghaziabad
484.article_body: Two minor girls, aged nine and six years, were injured after a speeding car rammed into them in Ghaziabad on Thursday, according to a report. The driver left behind the car and fled the spot after hitting the girls, who were walking together on the road. Meanwhile, police have seized the car and launched an investigation to identify the driver.

485.title: Nandi Hills near B'luru will become int'l tourist destination: Minister
485.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said that he is extremely happy as the state government approved the ₹93.40-crore ropeway project at Nandi hills, a popular getaway near Bengaluru. He said, "With the passenger ropeway...Nandi Hills will become an international tourist destination." Notably, the ropeway will be 2.93 km long, have 18 towers and each round-trip will take about 28 minutes.

486.title: Tesla may accept Dogecoin as payment at Supercharger stations in future, hints Musk
486.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said in future Tesla charging stations may be able to accept Dogecoin as payment. Ryan Zohoury, founder of Tesla Console, tweeted, "Ten minutes after...new Santa Monica Superchargers opened and they're already almost full!" while tagging Musk. "And futuristic diner/ drive-in theater planned for Hollywood area! And of course, you can pay in Ðoge," Musk replied.

487.title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff, preparing for a massive layoff: Report
487.article_body: US-based online mortgage lender Better.com is preparing for another massive layoff nearly three months after its CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, TechCrunch reported. The layoffs could affect as much as 40% to 50% of Better.com's staff and are expected to happen in March. The startup's four more top executives have resigned recently, the report said.

488.title: It's my honour: Bhumi Pednekar on chance to speak at Harvard University
488.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar, who will speak about climate change at Harvard University, said she is honoured to get a chance. "I wanted to reach out to as many people as possible on this in my country and...across the world," Bhumi added. The actress, who had earlier started the campaign 'Climate Warrior', said everyone must take responsibility for climate protection.

489.title: 21-yr-old arrested for jumping Mumbai airport wall, probe underway
489.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) officers on Saturday apprehended a 21-year-old man after he climbed down a wall at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport. Chief Security Officer of the Airport, Shrikant Kishore, said, the man had been handed over to the police for further investigation. The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security is also probing the incident.

490.title: Actor Vijay apologises after crowd follows him to polling booth in Chennai
490.article_body: Actor Vijay cast his vote for the local body elections in Chennai on Saturday. However, as soon as he arrived at the polling booth, Vijay got surrounded by a huge crowd and media, causing inconvenience to the general public. Upon noticing the chaos, Vijay immediately stood around the crowd and apologised with folded hands.

491.title: Astronomers find 1st evidence of fast radio burst in galaxy merger
491.article_body: Astronomers from India, US discovered first evidence of fast radio bursts (FRB) in galaxy merger via Giant Metrewave Radio Telescope. Team mapped FRB host galaxy and found ten times more hydrogen than nearby galaxies but relatively less stars indicating hydrogen formation post possible merger of two galaxies. FRBs are extremely bright radio pulses lasting for less than a few milliseconds.

492.title: Bodybuilder constable from Hyd urges youth to focus on fitness
492.article_body: DA Kumar, a 2010 batch Hyderabad Police constable has participated in Mr India Bodybuilding competition 2022, becoming the first constable from Telangana to do so. Describing his routine, Kumar, who's stationed at Langar House police station, said he works out twice daily while also performing his 12-hour duty. He further advised youth to focus on fitness and stop liquor consumption.

493.title: David Brenner, Oscar-winning editor working on 'Avatar' sequels, dies at 59
493.article_body: Oscar-winning editor David Brenner, who worked on films like 'Justice League' and 'Independence Day', passed away aged 59. Brenner died on Thursday morning at his home in West Hollywood, his wife told Hollywood Reporter. Before his death, Brenner had been working on James Cameron's 'Avatar' sequels. "His talent, compassion and friendship will be truly missed," James Cameron tweeted.

494.title: NATO chief offers more talks with Russia amid Ukrainian crisis
494.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Saturday said he wrote to Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov offering more talks between NATO Council, Russia to defuse the Ukrainian crisis. "It is not too late for Russia to change course, to step back from the brink..." Stoltenberg said. Meanwhile, Russia ordered massive military drills including practice launches for nuclear missiles on Saturday.

495.title: Russia launches missiles in nuclear drills amid tensions with Ukraine
495.article_body: Russia on Saturday said it hit sea and land-based targets with ballistic and cruise missiles that were launched as part of its strategic nuclear exercises amid tensions with Ukraine. The exercise featured launches of Kinzhal and Tsirkon hypersonic missiles and a number of other weapons, Kremlin said. The exercise was overseen by Russian President Vladimir Putin.

496.title: Tesla changes S Korea ad as probe finds exaggerated claims on battery
496.article_body: Tesla changed an advertisement on its South Korean website about the driving range for its Model 3 after an antitrust regulator found that it exaggerated the specifications of its batteries. The description of Tesla's Model 3 was changed to say the vehicle is capable of travelling a "maximum" of 528 kilometres on a single charge, from "more than" 528 kilometres.

497.title: 14 killed, over 4,320 displaced in Madagascar due to tropical storm
497.article_body: At least 14 people were killed and more than 4,320 people were displaced in Madagascar this week by tropical Storm Dumako, the state disaster relief agency said on Friday. The Storm Dumako made landfall in the east of the country on Tuesday. The country's national meteorological service has warned that another cyclone, Emnati, will make landfall in Madagascar on Tuesday.

498.title: Six African countries to get mRNA COVID-19 vaccine tech: WHO
498.article_body: Egypt, Kenya, Nigeria, Senegal, South Africa and Tunisia to receive mRNA technology to develop COVID-19 vaccines, said World Health Organisation (WHO) during the EU-African Union summit at Brussels on Friday. As part of project, a hub in South Africa established vaccine production at laboratory scale and will be working towards commercial production. The project was launched in June last year.

499.title: India-UAE trade pact to help jewellery sector get export boost: Commerce Secy
499.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said that India's jewellery sector will get a huge export boost after the India-UAE trade pact as it will now get duty-free access in the UAE market. The gulf nation will also get greater access to the gold market here as India will give duty concessions on imports of up to 200 tonnes/year, he added.

500.title: Very happy to see how Venkatesh Iyer has progressed: Rohit Sharma
500.article_body: Talking about Venkatesh Iyer who scored 33 runs off 18 deliveries in India's second T20I against West Indies, Indian captain Rohit Sharma said he is "very happy" to see how Venkatesh has progressed. "To see such maturity is very pleasing. We need such characters. Venkatesh backs his skills and that is what every captain wants," added Rohit.

501.title: Serbia's Ambassador falls to his death from a cliff in Portugal
501.article_body: Serbia's Ambassador to Portugal, Oliver Antic, has died after falling from a cliff in the beach town of Cascais on Friday, local authorities said. Maritime police and firefighters pulled Antic out of the water alive, but resuscitation efforts were unsuccessful, a local report said. Antic was "an excellent professor...and a lawyer with a sharp mind", Serbia's Foreign Ministry said.

502.title: We'll have another pandemic with a different virus: World's 4th richest person Gates
502.article_body: World's fourth richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates told CNBC that the risks of severe disease from COVID-19 have "dramatically reduced" but "we'll have another pandemic". "It will be a different pathogen next time," he said. Gates added, "The cost of being ready for the next pandemic is not that large. It's not like climate change."

503.title: I want to clear my head and play according to the situation: Pant
503.article_body: Rishabh Pant said he wants to "clear" his head and play according to the situation having been India's joint-highest run-getter in the second T20I against West Indies, scoring 52* off 28 balls. "I am fine with batting at any position. I always enjoy what I do," added Pant. Pant was named Player of the Match in the second T20I.

504.title: Man distracted by phone falls through hole in floor in Turkish mall; video viral
504.article_body: A video showing a man busy on his mobile phone falling into an open storage hole inside a mall in Turkey has gone viral on social media. The man can be seen landing onto a pile of boxes on the floor underneath which broke his fall. He said that he was glad to have emerged unharmed.

505.title: BJP agent objects to hijab-wearing woman in TN, removed from booth
505.article_body: A BJP poll agent, Girirajan, was removed from a polling booth in Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Saturday after he objected to a woman wearing hijab. He reportedly asked her to take it off, saying he's unable to verify her identity. "I will definitely raise this issue, irregularity is taking place here," he said. Voting was disrupted for nearly 15 minutes.

506.title: Kajol wishes mother-in-law Veena Devgan on her birthday, pens note
506.article_body: Kajol took to Instagram to pen a note for her mother-in-law Veena Devgan on her birthday. "Here's a cheer to someone who has always been there for me and on many days I feel more married to than even my husband (Ajay Devgn)...Happy birthday to this awesome woman," she wrote. "This is so cute," a fan commented on Kajol's post.

507.title: Was refreshing to see him play aerial shots: Gavaskar on Kohli's 52
507.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 52 in India's second T20I against West Indies, Sunil Gavaskar said it was "refreshing" to see Kohli play aerial shots like the cut and guide shots. "It shows there is a different purpose. Kohli played some of those delicate shots which we don't see," added Gavaskar. "Kohli has got the instinct for a run," stated Gavaskar.

508.title: No point giving Ruturaj 1 game, select Kishan: Jaffer on 3rd T20I
508.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said there is "no point" giving Ruturaj Gaikwad one game by selecting him for India's third T20I against West Indies, adding that India should continue with Ishan Kishan. Kishan has scored 37 runs in the ongoing T20I series. "Kishan was bought for ₹15.25 crore in the mega auction which plays on the minds of players," stated Jaffer.

509.title: Akshaye Khanna joins Ajay Devgn and Tabu in 'Drishyam 2': Report
509.article_body: Akshaye Khanna has reportedly joined the cast of 'Drishyam 2', starring Ajay Devgn, Tabu and Shriya Saran. According to the report, Akshay will play a "sharp cop who is on Ajay's tail and determined to pin the charge on him". 'Drishyam 2', which went on floors on February 17, will feature Ajay as Vijay Salgaonkar and Tabu as Meera Deshmukh.

510.title: No player knows how to break a racquet like Federer, jokes Tsitsipas
510.article_body: Stefanos Tsitsipas joked that no player knows how to break a racquet the way Roger Federer does, adding that Daniil Medvedev is the "GOAT (Greatest of All Time)" at arguing with the umpire. "The most beautiful person that smashes racquets and he hasn't done that a lot...but in terms of finesse when he does it is Federer," stated Tsitsipas.

511.title: Berkshire had no prior knowledge of Microsoft-Activision deal: Buffett
511.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway, which invested in Activision Blizzard last year, "had no prior knowledge" that Microsoft was planning to acquire the video game maker. Berkshire held nearly 14.7 million shares in Activision Blizzard as of December 31. The stock purchase was made ahead of Activision's $69-billion deal with Microsoft, which was announced in January.

512.title: India announce their squad for T20I series against Sri Lanka
512.article_body: India have announced their squad for the upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka, with Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant being rested for the series. Wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson has been recalled to the squad, while Ravindra Jadeja also makes a return after recovering from an injury. Jasprit Bumrah, who was rested for the West Indies series, has also been included.

513.title: Tharoor replies as Indian embassy in Kuwait criticises him over 'anti-India tweet'
513.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor retweeted a tweet saying Kuwaiti Parliamentarians have sought a ban on entry of BJP leaders into Kuwait over the hijab row. The Indian embassy in Kuwait reacted by saying, "Sad to see an Indian MP retweeting an anti-India tweet by a Pakistani agent." Tharoor said he didn't "endorse this individual" but was "concerned about sentiment he conveyed".

514.title: Ukraine invasion could cost Russia a prosperous future: EU chief
514.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said Russia's threats towards Ukraine could reshape the "entire international system" and would also cost Moscow economically. She warned Russia that the Ukraine invasion could cost the country a "prosperous future". Russia reportedly has some 1,90,000 troops on the Ukrainian border, the biggest military build-up in Europe since World War II.

515.title: Antique idols, rare manuscripts worth ₹10 cr seized from Chennai shop
515.article_body: CID's Idol Wing seized three idols and 11 rare manuscripts from a showroom's cottage in Chennai's Alwarpet on Friday. As per the expert who inspected the idols, two of these idols as well as the manuscripts are antique and worth ₹10 crore in market. The police are yet to ascertain the origin and language of the manuscripts containing Buddhist inscriptions.

516.title: India announce their squad for Test series against Sri Lanka; Pujara, Rahane dropped
516.article_body: India have announced their squad for the upcoming Test series against Sri Lanka, with senior players Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane being dropped from the team. Rohit Sharma will lead the squad, which also includes Shreyas Iyer, Hanuma Vihari and KS Bharat. All-rounder Saurabh Kumar has received his maiden call-up, while Wriddhiman Saha and Ishant Sharma have also been dropped.

517.title: SEBI proposes new disclosure norms for IPOs of loss-making firms
517.article_body: SEBI has proposed to tighten disclosure standards for new-age technology companies that are planning to list their shares but don't fulfil the three-year profitability track. As per its proposal, such companies will have to disclose more details about how they arrived upon their IPO price. This comes as shares of several firms, including Paytm and Zomato, plunged post their listing.

518.title: Delhi HC orders 3 retired Kashmiri officers to vacate govt accommodations
518.article_body: Delhi High Court directed three retired Kashmiri officers to vacate government accommodations allotted to them on or before March 31, 2022. The retired Central government officials had challenged the eviction orders issued by the Centre. The petitioners had sought permission to retain the government accommodation, claiming they are Kashmiri Migrants. "The petition is devoid of merit," HC ruled.

519.title: Pvt hospitals have 20 lakh unused vaccine doses in Pune: Report
519.article_body: Private hospitals in Pune city have about 20 lakh unused doses of Covishield, a report quoting an industry representative said. "Every month we'll have to discard about...3 lakh doses...if they aren't administered before their expiry date," the representative said. Many hospitals have requested Pune Municipal Corporation to replace their current batches of vaccines with new ones, an official said.

520.title: Traders object as Palika Bazaar named in US' list of notorious markets
520.article_body: Palika Bazaar Association has objected after the Delhi market was named in the US' Notorious Markets List of 2021 for allegedly selling counterfeit products. It demanded to drop the market's name from the list, condemning the "false allegations". The list identified 35 physical markets globally that are "reported to engage in or facilitate substantial trademark counterfeiting or copyright piracy".

521.title: 3 police personnel on poll duty lose lives, 25 injured as bus overturns in Odisha
